194560.name: Alpha
194560.description:
Introduction

Alpha is a territory and connection game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the cells of a hexhex board, which is initially empty. The suggested board size is between 5 and 8 cells per side. Both players must have access to a sufficient number of black and white stones.


Definitions

A group is a set of connected, like-colored stones. A single stone is also a group.


Play

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On their turn, a player must place one stone of any color on an empty cell.

The game ends when the board is full. A player's score is the product of the size of the largest group of their color and the number of distinct groups of their color in the final position. The player with the highest score wins. In case of a tie, whoever has fewer stones of their color on the board wins.


Pie rule

The pie rule is used to make the game fair. This means that White will have the option, on his first turn only, to change sides instead of making a regular move.

194561.name: Champions Superheroes
194561.description:
Front of box:
25mm metal figures for adventure games and collecting
FREE Starter Scenario Game Aid and Figure Accessories
For Ages 10 and up

Back of box:
Champions Superheroes
The Superheroes' titanic struggle for justice has been the subject of hundreds of movies, thousands of comics and millions of daydreams. Yet, that may change soon! Thanks to Grenadier Models and Hero Games' Champions (tm) provides you with the rules, and Grenadier offers you miniatures sculpted in true comic book style. All that is needed now is your imagination.
Grenadier's Agents & Spies (tm) figures from the Secret Agent boxed set make excellent cops, thugs and civilians. These figures are the same scale and will look right at home alongside the Champions (tm) Super Heroes and Super Villians.

Figure Design: Andrew Chernak
Box Art: Flint Henry
Scenario Design: Gary Pilkington

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
194562.description:
Les Poilus: Aux Ordres! is an expansion for The Grizzled that consists of three elements:


Rules for solitaire play.
New rules for playing with two players.
Mission cards that present players with new challenges that scale in difficulty based on their experience.


On this last topic, mission cards come in easy, normal and hard difficulty levels, and based on the experience of the players, you set up a deck of missions.

Each round, the mission leader draws two of these cards, then decides which one to attempt. These missions might affect the number of starting cards in a round or allow players not to lose a round due to a specific condition, such as night or rain.

List of contents: 39 Mission cards; 1 Final Assault / Last Stand card; 4 Support tiles for solo version; 1 Novice card for duo version; 6 cut-outs of your Grizzled; 1 Rule booklet
194562.name: The Grizzled: At Your Orders!
boardgamepodcastepisode: #21: The Grizzled on tap, CMoN Expo, The Beer Traveler: Atlanta
1P 116 - The Grizzled
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 014 – Dead of Winter vs Robinson Crusoe
Episode 94 -- Giving My Trigger a Warning
Episode Charlie - 2016 Retrospective
Game Ramblings
HLG 6: Samen
Podcast EP08 – Entrevue avec L’École du Jeu
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 130
The Grizzled: At Your Orders! Review with the Game Boy Geek

194563.name: Ventisette
194563.description:
In Ventisette ("twenty-seven"), the player's task is to save money throughout a month. The board represents a calendar where players can find events like receiving mails, buy stuff, great deals, even local elections and, at last, the 27th day, when players will receive money from their job. Players receives mails with something they can buy or bills they have to pay, like electricity bills, assurance bills,restaurant bills. Once a month ends players must make counts on what they pay and how much they can save. When they finish, a new month starts.
Players must choose how many months a play has.
The winner is the player who saves most and has the least debts.

194565.description:
Battle Roller is a tabletop miniatures game focused on Mecha PvP combat. The idea is to capture the feel of games like Armored Core and Titan Fall on the tabletop while still having a system that is easy to get into but with depth for more immersive and challenging game play.

Players take on the role of Roller Pilots, customizing and preparing their Rollers for combat. Each Roller (similar to a mech or power suit) is customizable allowing players to mix and match parts to suit their play style. The deluxe papercraft miniatures as well as the console/dashboard cards are configurable to match the build choices that the player makes.

During the game players allocate EN (energy) to different systems for offence, defense, movement, and initiative and are locked into those actions for the upcoming round. As they take damage, they lose EN and their systems will go offline until they are no longer able to continue.

The starter set includes PDFs (letter sized) for the rule book, the Forest Map with obstacles, console cards with EN markers and 2D minis for 4 pre-configured Rollers and Pilots, sticker sheet for Action Dice, and parts and assembly instructions for the deluxe miniatures for the 4 pre-configured Rollers and Pilots.
194565.name: Battle Roller

194566.name: DrinkMaster Says...
194566.description:
From the back of the box:

DrinkMaster Says is the ultimate party in a pack. The game is an exciting mix of rules and challenges, loaded with non-stop action. Once you start playing you may never want to stop!

The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all your cards. Along the way, you might have to drink with o hands, balance stuff on your head, or be part of a burping competition ,just to name a few.

So gather your friends, pop open your favorite beverage and deal out the cards - Find out who among you can truly be called DrinkMaster!

There are 2 types cards:

Blue Cards - These cards are known as the Challenge Cards. Attempt to put your skills to the test. If the player is victorious, he/she does not drink and may distribute that amount of drinks to the other player(s).
Green Cards - These are known as the Rule Cards. Follow the rules or drink. Rule Cards are in effect until replaced by the next rule card that is placed on top.

Red Boxes - The boxes on the bottom half of the Rules Cards are known as the Action Boxes. These are specific tasks that must be completed by the person that plays the card.

Numbers on Cards - Located in the upper left corner of all cards. This is the number of drinks to be had if anyone breaks a rule or loses a challenge.

Each player is dealt four cards. Play begins to the left of the dealer. The first player can choose to play either color card to begin the game. The next player must play a card of the opposite color (or take a drink and skip their turn.) Discard the used card face up in the appropriate pile (during play you should have two piles - a Rules pile and a Challenge pile). Play continues to the left until directed differently by the Action Boxes.

194567.name: Mischa Morninglight
194567.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mischa is a lawful neutral female dwarf with cleric levels who specializes in healing, recovery, and melee combat utilizing the sun domain and restoration subdomain.

Oops! That six-hour marathon game session started 15 minutes ago, and you have already killed a player character (PC)! He was decapitated while being consumed in dragon fire, and his corpse fell into a sphere of annihilation. Your prediction for recovery is “not likely.” You built pre-generated characters for this campaign six months and four character levels ago! You don’t want your player to sit and read the newspaper for the next 5.75 hours. You need a comparable-level character sheet quickly.

OR… A new player has just shown up to your table willing to learn to sling dice. You found out he or she was coming thirty minutes before game time. Your regular crew of miscreants has already killed off all the spare pre-generated characters you rolled up with gleeful abandon, while cackling wildly and uttering something about “drive ‘em like you stole ‘em.” You want this first gaming experience to be fun and memorable, so you don’t want to completely wing it. You need a character sheet, right now.

Welcome to Instant Character! Just add a player, and go! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules. The core format adheres to the standard non-player character (NPC) stat block most GMs are already familiar with minus the Tactics section. This makes it easier for the GM to assist with finding information and also prepares the player for the day he or she is running games! The Special Abilities section includes more detailed write-ups of feats and character abilities than a standard NPC stat block to facilitate faster play. Sources for spells, races, classes, archetypes, and prestige classes from sources other than the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ (PZO1110) are listed in the Sources section and can be referenced in the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Reference Document.

At the end of this document is a sheet of character and spell tokens including a token for this character and assorted Non-Player Characters (NPCs) and spell effects. For best results, print the token page and laminate the entire sheet. Initially cut out into squares. To improve ability to move and pick up the laminated tokens, trim off the gray corners to make an octagonal shape.

194568.name: Spells of Boon & Burden
194568.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adding over 100 psychic spell options for Occult Adventures classes, the third release of the Book of Beyond series is here: Book of Beyond - Spells of Boon and Burden!

Spells of Boon and Burden was designed and written to expand both the flavor and mechanics of the psychic spellcaster classes introduced in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Occult Adventures expansion. In particular the aim of the this supplement is to make the psychic classes standout more clearly.

Arcane classes have long reigned over damage with spells of fiery destruction and divine casters present themselves as the game’s premier healers. While loaded with flavor it became clear to Lost Spheres that the psychic classes weren’t “the best” at anything in particular and as a whole were missing a signature class strength.

Allusions to the power of ki and lifeforce manipulation exist in the initial spell lists but nothing that really stood out as “this is the identity of psychic magic.” The concepts were there, including undercasting (allowing to expanded versatility). However the opportunity to awaken the full potential of the psychic magic universe seemed still looming.

The spells presented in this book expand the psychic role as life force manipulators, mentalists, and agents of cosmic balance.

Spells of Boon

Boons are special spells available to psychic mages to grant rapid beneficial abilities to allies at a similar cost to themselves. Spell casters who are immune to the condition that a boon inflicts are not able to cast that boon.

Spells of Burden

Psychic magic for the Pathfinder Roleplaying game more directly than its arcane and divine cousins interacts with the balance of individual spiritual forces and their relation to the world around them. Spiritual concepts of personal balance have been a staple of philosophy of societies both real and imagined for years yet seldom find expression in game mechanics.

194569.name: The Flute of Farewell
194569.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Poisoned Pages Adventure for Expert Characters

The Children of the Second Gathering are a cult made up of faerie folk, their kin, and mortals who believe the elves did not abandon Urth forever and will one day return to gather the ones left behind and ferry them to the hidden kingdoms. A small cult deemed foolish by mortal and immortal alike, a collector of rare antiques named Sammandria Jann stumbled across a relic the cult members would kill to get their hands on—and that might kill them right back.

The Flute of Farewell is an adventure for expert characters in which the characters are hired to deliver the flute to the cult and bring payment back to their employer. Things become difficult when not all of the cult members want to pay and, worse, when the flute’s original owner comes looking for it. The characters complete the adventure after confronting the devil summoned by sounding the relic.

boardgamepublisher: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)
194572.description:
The first expansion for Statecraft - the Political Card Game.

National Politics adds in a real dimension to the world of Statecraft, with contemporary and historical policies, characters, events and actions available to exploit in your nefarious political campaigns to dominate whichever nation you've surged to the fore in.

National Politics (UK & USA) contains 27 cards which fully integrate with the core Statecraft set, and offers players further customisation of their starting set up, as well as new policies and actions to field in-game.
194572.name: Statecraft: the Political Card Game – National Politics Expansion (UK & USA)

rpg: Room 66a: A Treasure Chest Guarded by Two Orcs
194573.name: Room 66a: A Treasure Chest Guarded by Two Orcs
194573.description:
From the introduction:

This is a one-act story game for two players, though others may be added if required.

Our drama takes place in a dungeon, within which there is a room containing a treasure chest guarded by two orcs (or more, if required.) The orcs are not clear on whose dungeon they are in, what is in the chest or why they are standing here guarding it, though they expect a party of adventurers to arrive and try to steal it, at some time, soon... possibly. The orcs are surprisingly erudite and loquacious, as we shall see.

194574.name: Power Grab
194574.description:
From the introduction:

This is a game in the superhero genre for 3-5 players plus a GM.

194575.name: Loża Szyderców
194575.description:
Inspired by Cards Against Humanity comes Loża Szyderców ("Lodge of Mockers").
It has some creative action cards like "Liberum Veto" or "Why so serious?!" to spice up the game and a little bit change the original CAH formula.
It also have a dedicated app for the community od Loża Szyderców.

194576.name: Vox Populi
194576.description:
From the introduction:

Congratulations! You and your comrades have overthrown the Evil Overlord and liberated the land from his tyrannical grip; now all citizens are free once more to live their lives as they choose, within the new laws & policies being laid down by the Republic, i.e. you and your comrades.

194577.name: La Vallée des Rois
194577.description:
A magical medallion from the last Egyptian excavation has attracted the attention of two famous adventurers — Tara Wolf and Montana Smith — who then decide to explore the Valley of the Kings in search of hidden treasures.

While playing La Vallée des Rois, they will be surrounded by good companions who might help them avoid deadly traps and withstand the wrath of the gods of Egypt, but in this quest, only one adventurer can reap fame and wealth...

194578.name: La Vallée des Rois: L'Éveil de Nyarlathotep
194578.description:
La Vallée des Rois: L'Éveil de Nyarlathotep is a 32-card expansion that transforms La Vallée des Rois into something of a different game as now one of the adventurers leads a cult and plans to use the treasures found in the tombs to carry out their evil plans, while the opponent tries to stop him with the help of a handful of scholars and courageous investigators.

Each player has a deck of ten specific cards that includes allies, traps and equipment, from which they draw one card per turn. The three papyrus received by the cultist player early in the game does not come from the usual papyrus, but six "Cthulhu Mythos" papyrus that cite terrible deities and avatars such as Nyarlathotep Yig or that cast spells causing death and madness.

Two tombs are replaced with alternate versions, and terrifying creatures borne from a mythology of ancient evil gods await players.

194579.name: Patchwork
videogamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Runner Up
194579.description:
In the long-awaited digital adaptation of Uwe Rosenberg’s award-winning Patchwork, players patch their way to victory using fabric pieces of assorted sizes, colors, and buttons. The best quilt is the fullest, and whoever can patch up their quilt the most and collect more buttons wins the game – but be resourceful and plan every stitch! Keep an eye on the costs and the time it takes to stitch a patch to be the best patchwork master. Play against quilters from around the world on multiple platforms and compete for the highest rank. Face computer opponents, or stick to a solo game. Patch your way to the top in Patchwork!

You and your opponent are both patchwork apprentices with the goal of producing the biggest (and therefore warmest) blanket. In order to do so the players have to pick the best out of randomly available patchwork pieces in order to fill the holes of their blankets. But aesthetics in the form of buttons is also important as pieces are paid with buttons and the best way to earn more is to sew pieces with buttons on them on their blanket. Knowing when to place which piece while keeping the limited time and resources in mind makes all the difference between victory and defeat.

Source: The Game Website.

194580.name: Beyond the Glow
194580.description:
User summary:

Inspired by such commercial games as Gamma World, Metamorphosis Alpha, and Aftermath, as well as films such as Mad Max, Beyond the Glow presents a combined rules set and post-apocalyptic setting. Characters are defined by Species, Attributes, and Skills, as well as Mutations (both positive and negative). The game shares several similar mechanics with d20 systems, but is an original creation.

194581.name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – North American B-25 Mitchell
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War
194581.description:
From the publisher:[b/]

The North American B-25 Mitchell was an American twin engined medium bomber. It was used by many Allied air forces, in every theater of World War II, and saw service across four decades. It first gained fame for its use in the 18 April 1942 Tokyo Raid, in which 16 B-25Bs led by Lieutenant Colonel Jimmy Doolittle attacked mainland Japan, four months after the bombing of Pearl Harbor.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW2 Wings of Glory™ Special Pack is a ready-to-play large size model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards, as well as specific rules and components necessary to use the airplane.

194582.name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – Heinkel He.111
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War
194582.description:
From the publisher:

The Heinkel He.111 was a fast medium bomber, developed by the Luftwaffe in the ‘30s and constantly upgraded during the war. It was the primary German bomber in the early years of the war. The He.111 was used in a variety of roles: it was used as a strategic bomber during the Battle of Britain, a torpedo bomber during the Battle of the Atlantic, and a medium bomber and a transport aircraft on the Western, Eastern, Mediterranean, Middle Eastern, and North African Fronts.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW2 Wings of Glory™ Special Pack is a ready-to-play large size model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards, as well as specific rules and components necessary to use the airplane.

194584.name: Which Friend
194584.description:
Which Friend is a social game that was designed to bring friends together. It promotes interaction and laughter as the question cards tend to bring up old stories and funny instances that are unique to each set of friends that play the game. It involves thought and strategy, and is a great way to see which of your friends knows each other best.

The object of the game is to vote with the majority. Each player is given a rotating voting wheel that has a specific number on the back that represents themselves. After a question is read from the pile of question cards, each player rotates their voting wheel to display the number associated with the player they feel best represents the question. Once all players have chosen their vote and rotated the voting wheel to the appropriate number, all voting wheels shall be flipped over and set on the playing surface simultaneously. Once the votes are tallied up, any player that voted with the majority is awarded a point.

If there is a tie, any players involved in the tie must try to persuade any players that are not involved in the tie to agree with their answer and swing their vote.

194585.name: Fervour
194585.description:
Fervour is a TCG under the LCG model. It is a simulation of a duel between two people in a world where people's beliefs become reality. Since emotions are the strongest feelings a person can have these are utilised to shape the environment to their favour.

There are three main Unique mechanics in Fervour:

1. Single action turns: Just like in a real fight, initiative goes back and forth and you can guard, respond and counter. With one action per turn games are fast-paced and energetic and have multiple tactics available rather than always a single “best play”.

2. Re-set every round: At the start of each round most of the cards on the field are re-shuffled and your hand is drawn again. This makes the game fast from the first turn of the game while still keeping it consistent.

3. Each card is useful: Each card has an elemental ability. All cards you can’t cast can be added to cards you can to buff them. So it doesn’t matter if you can play all your cards or only one, both hands are good in their own way. Also when casting a card the top card of your deck is flipped and its elemental ability is added and if it’s an emotion (your resources) then you play it and can use it on that turn.

194586.name: Combat Chess (1997)
194586.description:
User Summary

Combat Chess takes the basic chess game and adds an imaginative element for players bored with the simple "black vs. white" chess board.Combat Chess is written to Grand Master standards and supports play against human opponents.

194587.description:
Extra deck of cards for Cards Against IT with Security based cards.
Pomotion item from Varonis, an IT security company
194587.name: Cards Against Info Security

194589.name: Ramasjang
194589.description:
Loki was a clever and crafty god and when he played games with some of the other gods in Asgard he made up rules for his own games. This made sure that the game was confusing and different every time so he was the only one who could win. The other gods really wanted to be better than Loki so they tried their best to beat him. So it became a tradition to gather around one of Loki’s games. This festive tradition got the name Ramasjang.

Gather your friends for a fun fast changing card game! It’s fun and easy to shape like Loki the shapeshifter himself.

Now each player is dealt seven cards. The cards have different rules which you generate every hand. The person who sits left to the dealer starts.

The card laid on top of the discard pile has to match the suit or the number unless a rule says otherwise. If you can’t lay a card you must pick a card from the deck. After picking up the card you have the possibility to lay it if possible and if you still can’t go it’s the next players turn.

From here you can add new rules to the cards without any limits. The idea as Loki changed the rules to win, here each of the player takes it in turn either during play or between hands to add to the rules.

A player wins, in a singled hand game by getting rid of all his cards despite the rule changes. In a longer point scoring game a player wins when they have the least points when an opponent hits a value agreed at the start of the game.

194590.name: Ienomi
194590.description:
User summary:
イエノミ (Ienomi) in English literally means "Drinking at home", and the designer suggests "Come over for drinks!".

You have a drinking session in someone's home. You fall asleep if you have drunk more than your limit, but you don't know how much it is. You have to estimate your limit by opponents' limits, and score points by pacing your drinking.

The session ends when all players have fallen asleep, and the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary:
誰かの自宅を会場にして飲み会を開きます。
自分の体力を超える酒量を飲んでしまうと強制的に寝落ちしますが、プレイヤーは自分の体力だけ知りません。
他のプレイヤーの体力を見て推定しながら、酒を飲んで得点を増やしていきます。
全員が寝ると飲み会が終わり、そこで最も得点を持っている人が勝利です。

194591.description:
From the publisher:

A map-making, tile-laying adventure for the whole family. Evolving as you play, what might start off as an all-against-all race to the prize might turn into a co-operative challenge, with players needing to work together to navigate the traps and get to the treasure.

2-8 players take on the role of pirate cartographers(map makers) who've washed ashore on the revered "Scuttler's Island" - legendary hiding place for the gold of sunken ships of old.

Players take it in turns to draw tiles and extend their paths, sabotage a rival's or lay down an item token to overcome an obstacle. The first player(s) to reach the X in the middle with an uninterrupted path wins!

With 1 cloth map, 36 item tokens, 140 map tiles and - no two games are the same!
194591.name: Scuttler's Island

194592.name: The Bridge of Zheng He
194592.description:
From the publishers blurb:

A small group of goblins have taken command of a choke point along an old dwarven pass deep inside a mountain. The players will need to battle, or negotiate, their way while dealing with the goblins.

This short adventure details a dungeon found deep inside a mountain and can be used with an existing campaign as an evening's diversion. Product includes the adventure PDF and two map files for printing or use in a VTT.

boardgamedesigner: Jyujin Ohtsbo (おーつぼじゅうじん)
194593.name: Painter Detective
boardgameartist: Jyujin Ohtsbo (おーつぼじゅうじん)
boardgamepublisher: Joynt Game Factory (ジョイントゲームファクトリー)
194593.description:
User summary:
似顔絵探偵 (Nigaoe Tantei) is Painter Detective.

In the game of Painter Detective, one player takes the role of detective, and the others are the witnesses.

Each suspect card depicts a face of a suspect, and a criminal is chosen randomly from 48 suspect cards. The witnesses looks at the face of the criminal and memorize its characteristics in five seconds. Then each witness is assigned one or two face parts they must explain, and describes the criminal's characteristics by verbal method only. The detective listens to the descriptions and draws a composite sketch, and tells the criminal from the suspect cards.

Publisher's summary:
まず、プレイヤーの中から１人の探偵役を決めます。その他は目撃者役です。
顔のイラストが描かれた、48枚の容疑者カードの中からランダムで、１枚の犯人を選びます。
目撃者役のプレイヤーのみ５秒間だけ見て、記憶します。その後、鼻、目、口・ひげ、輪郭などを示した、パーツカードが配られ、
各容疑者役のプレイヤーは自分の担当のパーツのみ、ジェスチャー無しで口だけで探偵役に伝えます。
探偵役は目撃者の話を聞いて、似顔絵を描き、その後、その絵を頼りに容疑者カードの中から犯人を捜し出します。

194594.description:
Heroes, stand ready! The gods are offering a seat in heaven to whichever hero defeats their rivals. Your courage and wits will be your most precious allies as you use divine dice to gather resources along the road to victory.

Your divine dice are exceptional, with removable faces! Customize your dice to make them more powerful as the game progresses. Sacrifice gold to the gods to obtain enhanced die faces. Upgrade your dice to produce the resources you need. Overcome ordeals concocted by the gods to grow in glory and earn rewards. Skillfully manage the luck of the dice and take charge of your destiny. Only the greatest will ascend to the heavens!

Dice Forge is a development game featuring innovative mechanics based on dice with removable faces. In this dice crafting game, players build their own dice. Roll your dice, manage your resources, complete ordeals before your opponents and explore multiple winning strategies.

Now you control the luck of the dice!
194594.name: Dice Forge
boardgamepodcastepisode: #42: A Trip to Asheville, Herbaceous on Tap, Well Played games cafe, Dream Home, OutLawed, Heroes & Tricks and lots more
27. Devon Dice Podcast: The Balancing Act: Assassins, Beasts, Children, Designers
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 033 – Great Western Trail vs The Oracle of Delphi
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 037 – Top 10 Publishers

194595.name: Amazons vs Valkyries: Advanced Races
194595.description:
From publisher blurb:

This file features 6 New advanced races for players including:

Dvergar: Repulsive little metalworkers with a severe aversion to sunlight.
Fauns: Hedonistic and playful fairies who protect the wilderness from harm
Jotnar: Extra-dimensional giants with an affinity for fire or ice.
Ljosalfar: Angelic sorcerers and servants of the Vanir.
Nymphs: Ageless maidens with supernatural beauty and a kinship with the gods.
Reptilians: Prehistoric humanoids who live in a city deep within the earth.




With this supplement, players in the Amazons Vs Valkyries Campaign Setting may choose from six non-human races. Your character may be a lumbering giant from Jotunheim, or a wild faun obsessed with partying and celebration. She may be a revolting dwarf-like thing with a twisted sense of humor, or she may be an angelic warrior with an allegiance to the Vanir.

Each of these advanced races is built with 20 racial points. Their powers, abilities and descriptions are drawn from the mythological source material, rather than modern fantasy fiction. These are magical races the way ancient people imagined them. Dvergar can be killed by sunlight, but they also have powerful spells. Ljosalfar have a gliding ability and are skilled with light magic. Fauns are infamous for their debauchery and musical talents. And nymphs are truly magical creatures, immune to aging.

Pick this supplement up today and add some racial diversity to your mythic campaign!

194596.name: Humanoid Special Abilities
rpgseries: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016
194596.description:
From publisher blurb:

Advantageous Abilities: Humanoid Special Abilities includes over a dozen abilities for GMs to give their NPCs an advantageous edge (or just a little role-playing fun).

Befuddle your PCs with abilities like Barroom Brawler and No Loyalty, add a little fun with "abilities" like Peg Leg, or give them something to worry about with the Poisoner ability. No matter your choice, this PDF is sure to make flavourful and effective NPCs.

194597.name: Feats of Sin
194597.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment of the More Feats! product line introduces a new kind of feat to your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: the sin feat. Sin feats are designed to represent a character’s vices and moral failings, though they are by no means restricted to evil or non-good characters. Though a few sin feats are supernatural in nature, and some even grant bonuses of the profane type, characters of any faith or alignment may wrestle with sinful vices – grappling with and overcoming such a moral complication often serves to highlight a character’s heroism.

This compilation brings together all of the Feats of Sin, showcasting the seven books with their original artwork by Rick Hershey. These books include Feats of Lust, Feats of Envy, Feats of Pride, Feats of Gluttony, Feats of Greed, Feats of Wrath, and Feats of Sloth.

Featuring feats like:

Acquisitive - Appraise as a move action, and over a short distance.
Boundless Pride - Take 6d6 nonlethal damage to re-roll a failed save.
Expressions of Lust - Describe an erotic torment that keeps listeners from sleeping restfully.
Envious Spell - Gain temporary hit points when you counter an altered spell with itself.
Hibernate - Enter a state of suspended animation.
Lazy Leadership - Grant a cohort or follower your actions instead of taking them yourself!
and many, many more sinful feats!

194598.name: The Sellsword: Hybrid Class - Fighter/Ranger
194598.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original concept by Adam Matherly, a martial hybrid class built upon the fighter and ranger. A mercenary by trade, the sellsword excels in the heat of battle, using both skill and talent to mow down the enemy while protecting his brothers. The sellsword relies on bravado, reputation, and skill to dispatch others for pay and glory.

194599.name: Urban Riot (System Neutral Edition)
194599.description:
From publisher blurb:

Riots provide almost limitless opportunities for adventure. However, few adventures feature riots because they are problematic to flesh out. Designing all the rioters and the many minor events the PCs witness would take more time to prepare than even the most diligent GM has at his disposal. That’s where Campaign Events: Urban Riot comes in. Presenting copious notes on the rioters themselves as well as minor events and dressing along with hooks, opportunities and complications it takes the hassle out of running an urban riot and lets the GM concentrate on the important details of the campaign!

194600.name: Masquerade Ball (System Neutral Edition)
194600.description:
From publisher blurb:

Masquerade balls are a feature of civilised urban life, and eventually the PCs may be invited to attend such a prestigious event. Perhaps they are invited to secretly meet a new patron or to stymie some plot of these attending the event or alternatively their adventure may start unexpectedly during such an event. Masquerade balls are excellent excuses for role-playing and offer an excellent change of pace to a typical adventure. However, designing all the guests and their costumes would take more time than even the most diligent GM has at his disposal.

That’s where Campaign Events: Masquerade Ball comes in. Presenting copious notes on masks, costumes and guests along with hooks, opportunities and complications it takes the hassle out of running a masquerade ball and lets the GM concentrate on the important details of the campaign!

194601.name: Zarathustra
194601.description:
From publisher blurb:

The master manipulator, always in the shadows… Zarathustra!

A Power Level 9 Rogue, Zarathustra is the perfect sociopath. Zarathustra is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Zarathustra’s file is designated “Orange" to identify his focus on skills and techniques bordering on the paranormal. More than anything else he employs, Zarathustra’s intelligence and complete lack of conscience make him a formidable adversary for a hero or team of heroes that catch his attention. He is bored of mundane challenges, only a truly brilliant foe will catch his interest, but he plays the long game and never reveals himself until he is sure of victory. The perfect Moriarty for your campaign’s Sherlock Holmes, he makes a very memorable mastermind indeed.

194602.name: Borderland Provinces (Pathfinder)
194602.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Borderland Provinces are balanced on the knife’s edge of history, as a decadent, declining empire retreats slowly, clinging to power even as it unravels.

This book contains the history of the Borderland Provinces region, descriptions of the countries, cities (some with maps), towns, important places, major geographical features, lairs, and extensive encounter tables for the ancient Hyperborean roads crisscrossing the Provinces. For those familiar with Lost Lands geography, the campaign book covers the Western part of our Sinnar Coast Region map, an area in great peril, located only a few hundred miles from Bardís Gate and directly adjacent to the Sundered Kingdoms.

Award-winning authors Matt Finch and Greg A. Vaughan weave a tapestry of high adventure in the context of a gritty, darkening region of the Lost Lands. And as with everything in the Lost Lands, all is not as it seems . . .

194603.name: Blood and Bronze (2005)
194603.description:
From the introduction:

Blood and Bronze is a role-playing game set in the classical period of Greek supremacy. When each city was a kingdom, with its army, lead by kings and heroes of legend, watched over by a patron god or goddess, and each desiring greater glory.

Players each take on the role of one of these cities and work to have their city reign unchallenged.

User summary:

Each player's city state also controls a hero.

194604.name: Companion Fever
194604.description:
From the introduction:

The USS Invincible, a US Navy Section Patrol Craft, has run aground on the beach of the Pacific island it was illicitly studying. A bad place to be for this thought-to-be-decommissioned cargo craft and even worse – for the seventy men on board.

In months, the region will erupt in flames – WW II.

User summary:

The game uses pre-built characters in specific roles.

194605.name: Crime Kings
194605.description:
User summary:

Characters in this rules-light game are members of a criminal gang that pull various heists. The rules recommend using a telephone book ("The Yellow Pages") as a source of potential targets. Characters are defined by narrative traits only and action resolution strongly favors narrative decisions over random process. Dice rolls may be used but are simple and generally have a minor role in the game.

boardgamedesigner: Jyujin Ohtsbo (おーつぼじゅうじん)
194606.name: The Eight-headed Dragon OROCHI
boardgameartist: Jyujin Ohtsbo (おーつぼじゅうじん)
boardgamepublisher: Joynt Game Factory (ジョイントゲームファクトリー)
194606.description:
User summary:
真説 大蛇のえじき (Shinsetsu Orochi no Ejiki), in English means "Victims of the Serpent: The True Story", is published with the English name The Eight-headed Dragon OROCHI.

Shinsetsu Orochi no Ejiki is a card game based on Yamata no Orochi Legends in Japanese mythology.

A game consists of seven rounds. Each round, players receive three human cards, each numbered 1-3, and one random special character card (Orochi, Susanoo, Oracle, Hermit, etc). They play one card simultaneously. If no one play Orochi, humans are safe and players who played a human with the lowest number score points. If Orochi is in play, humans are dead and the Orochi player scores points, but if both Orochi and Susanoo are in play, Susanoo slays Orochi and saves humans, and the Susanoo player steals points from the Orochi player. The game goes to next round after Orochi was played.
Players should predict opponents' moves to score points and win the game.

Publisher's summary:
日本神話の「ヤマタノオロチ伝説」を題材に、人狼系＆バッティングゲーム。7ラウンドで構成されたゲームで1ラウンドは最大4回プレイします。
プレイヤーはラウンド毎に１~３の基本カードとオロチやスサノオ、巫女、山伏など様々な役職を担当のカードを受け取ります。
ラウンド内でも得点が多い日もあれば少ない日もあります。
一番小さな数字のカードを出したプレイヤーが得点を得ます。
でも、オロチと一緒に出されるとオロチに食べられ、得点をオロチに持って行かれます。スサノオとオロチが同時に出るとオロチは倒されスサノオが得点を稼ぎます。このように、他のプレイヤーの動きを読みながら、より多くの得点の獲得を目指すゲームです。

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
194607.description:
A curse has been placed on the Valley of Life. Hearing the spirits of nature cry out for aid, clans of druids have arrived, determined to use their blessings to heal the land and rescue the spirits. It will require courage and also caution, as the curse can overwhelm the careless who wield too much power.

In Mystic Vale, 2 to 4 players take on the role of druidic clans trying to cleanse the curse upon the land. Each turn, you play cards into your field to gain powerful advancements and useful vale cards. Use your power wisely, or decay will end your turn prematurely. Score the most victory points to win the game!

Mystic Vale uses the innovative "Card Crafting System", which lets you not only build your deck, but build the individual cards in your deck, customizing each card's abilities to exactly the strategy you want to follow.
194607.name: Mystic Vale
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
#45: Six-Player Six Pack; Las Vegas on tap; Barcelona; Mystic Vale; Betrayal at the Brewery on the Hill

MN 0131 Mystic Vale
Podcast 31 – Mystic Vale

Strange Assembly 192 - Live From GenCon 2016
Strange Assembly 193 - GenCon 2016 in Review

Vox Republica 125: The Impact Of Large Scale Media
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 83!
WIPNcast 127

194608.name: Trodox (Issue 40 - Jan 2016)
194608.description:
Trodox Ars Arcana
Issue 40
January 2016

Das Fanzine für neugierige & experimentierfreudige Spielinteressierte

194609.name: Save the President, Save the World
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 021 – UK Games Expo 2016
194609.description:
Thanksgiving Day, the unthinkable happened. The earth shook. An earthquake of a 9.6 magnitude on the Richter scale opened a giant inter-dimensional rift around the White House, bridging the free world to some kind of mysterious void.

A massive horde of monsters came out of this dark void. Evil, frightening creatures hell-bent on crushing freedom and the man who represents them — The President of the United States!

They took the whole White House staff by surprise, slaughtering each and every single person. The Secret Service and Marine Guard gave their life heroically to protect the President, but ultimately failed at containing these hideous monstrosities. The President stands tall, undaunted. He has sworn an Oath to lead the free world, and he won't let us fall! Yet the end is near. Our President's life is at risk, and all hope seems lost...

But in the midst of this absolute chaos rises the silhouettes of men and women. Out of the rubble citizens & tourists become Patriots! They are this nation's last hope and together they stand! With one mission: Save the President, save the world!

Save the President, Save the World is a co-op game with offbeat humor & references to Z-movies. The action takes place in the White House and you have to protect POTUS from horde of monsters.

Any resemblance to real and actual names is purely coincidental.

194610.name: Trodox (Issue 39 - Dec 2015)
194610.description:
Trodox
Issue 39
December 2015

Das Fanzine für neugierige & experimentierfreudige Spielinteressierte

boardgamedesigner: Jyujin Ohtsbo (おーつぼじゅうじん)
194611.name: Tamaotch!
boardgameartist: Jyujin Ohtsbo (おーつぼじゅうじん)
boardgamepublisher: Joynt Game Factory (ジョイントゲームファクトリー)
194611.description:
User summary:
In the solitaire game of 魂落っち! (Tamaotch!), you are a god who collects souls into a new creature. You arrange 12 cards in a 3x4 matrix. Each card has two colored squares, so there are 6x4 colored squares in play.

Each round, you may rotate one card or switch positions of two adjacent cards. You score points if you form a line of three or more squares of the same color. The more lines you form, the more points you score. Cards used to form lines are removed, but you may choose some of them to be reshuffled. Then new cards are placed to fill the cleared space. Repeat this process until no lines are formed.

This game has puzzle and deck building factors. You should watch the play field closely to detect a big-point move. You should also think carefully which cards are to be removed and which to be reshuffled.

Publisher's summary:
プレイヤーは神様となって、魂を集めて、新しい生物を作るゲームです。
2色の色が上下に記されたカードを４列３段で並べ、
それを１ラウンドに１アクション（上下・左右の場所交換と上下の回転）をして、
同じ色を縦横斜めのいずれかで並べるようにして、セットを作るようにします。
セットが同時に沢山出来たら高得点！
なおかつ、使ったカードを山札に戻せるので、長続き出来る事になり、かつ、戻る色を選べるので山札の構築感が味わえます。

boardgamedesigner: Jyujin Ohtsbo (おーつぼじゅうじん)
194612.name: Ayasu
boardgameartist: Jyujin Ohtsbo (おーつぼじゅうじん)
boardgamepublisher: Joynt Game Factory (ジョイントゲームファクトリー)
194612.description:
User summary:
AYASU is a go-out-to-win style card game.

Each player starts with five cards. In your turn, you may play a card whose number is the same or adjacent to the recently played card (e.g. You may play 1, 2, or 3 on recently played 2). If your card shares the same animal icon with the recently played one, you must cry like that animal, and other players may calm that animal in appropriate manner (patting that player's head, tickling the chin, etc.). The first player who calmed correctly may play a card that shares the same animal icon.

The player who has emptied their hand wins the game.

Publisher's summary:
ゴーアウト型の
カードゲームで、各自5枚の手札でプレイします。
自分の手番では場札に対して、同じ数字、もしくは
つながっている数字（場札が2なら1か3）であれ
ば出すことができ、
場のカードと同じイラストが今自分の出したカード
にあれば、そのイラストの鳴き声を出さねばなりま
せん。また他のプレイヤーはその鳴いたプレイヤー
をいち早くあやすことで、同じイラストの入ってい
るカードを1枚出すことが出来ます。
最初に手札を無くしたプレイヤーが勝ちとなります。

194613.name: The Dinner Party
194613.description:
User summary:

Characters in this game are all rather mundane individuals who have gathered together at the host's house for a typical dinner party. Play involves characters pursuing their own, generally trivial, goals - often at the expense of the other guests. Game play proceeds in phases (turns), only some of which use dice. Characters in the game are pre-built and have defined roles.

194614.name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Teen Titans Promo Cards
194614.description:
This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


Robin: Teen Titans Team Leader
Raven: Rachel Roth (Alternate Art for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light)
Starfire: Powerful Friend

194615.name: The Dinner Party Handouts
194615.description:
User summary:

This document includes eight pre-generated characters for The Dinner Party and four pages of game accessories. Characters are given statistics, dice pools, a "Black Mark" count, and a narrative description.

194616.name: The Governor's Report Concerning the Doomed Assault on the Fire Moon
rpg: The Governor's Report Concerning the Doomed Assault on the Fire Moon
194616.description:
User summary:

In this game, play takes place in a fictional board of inquiry into a recent combat disaster. The game supposes a science fiction setting, though the same process could be used with nearly any genre. The game uses a custom deck of cards (provided as a print-and-play component in the document) to drive the action. Characters respond with narrative.

194617.name: Borderland Provinces (Swords & Wizardry)
194617.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Borderland Provinces are balanced on the knife’s edge of history, as a decadent, declining empire retreats slowly, clinging to power even as it unravels.

This book contains the history of the Borderland Provinces region, descriptions of the countries, cities (some with maps), towns, important places, major geographical features, lairs, and extensive encounter tables for the ancient Hyperborean roads crisscrossing the Provinces. For those familiar with Lost Lands geography, the campaign book covers the Western part of our Sinnar Coast Region map, an area in great peril, located only a few hundred miles from Bardís Gate and directly adjacent to the Sundered Kingdoms.

Award-winning authors Matt Finch and Greg A. Vaughan weave a tapestry of high adventure in the context of a gritty, darkening region of the Lost Lands. And as with everything in the Lost Lands, all is not as it seems . . .

194618.name: Borderland Provinces (5E)
194618.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Borderland Provinces are balanced on the knife’s edge of history, as a decadent, declining empire retreats slowly, clinging to power even as it unravels.

This book contains the history of the Borderland Provinces region, descriptions of the countries, cities (some with maps), towns, important places, major geographical features, lairs, and extensive encounter tables for the ancient Hyperborean roads crisscrossing the Provinces. For those familiar with Lost Lands geography, the campaign book covers the Western part of our Sinnar Coast Region map, an area in great peril, located only a few hundred miles from Bardís Gate and directly adjacent to the Sundered Kingdoms.

Award-winning authors Matt Finch and Greg A. Vaughan weave a tapestry of high adventure in the context of a gritty, darkening region of the Lost Lands. And as with everything in the Lost Lands, all is not as it seems . . .

194619.name: Founding Fathers
194619.description:
User summary:

Characters are all based on an original signer of the United States of America's Declaration of Independence. Play involves narrative discussion by the framers and utilizes a few colored tokens to indicate process (these are not strictly needed for play). The game uses only narrative development and assumes that all opposition will be resolved through consensus.

194620.name: Rune Lords 5
194620.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seven Spectacular Mythic Monsters for your AP!

Mythic Module Monsters: Rune Lords 5 brings you mythic versions of all six monsters in the bestiary section of issue #5 in the official Rune Lords AP:

ercinee
Herald of Dreams
Herald of Lamashtu
marsh giant
shemhazian demon
witchfire




The Mythic Monster Manual and Mythic Monsters series from Legendary Games have greatly expanded the number of mythic monsters available for use in Pathfinder campaigns of any kind, but if you want to add a bit of mythic mayhem to the classic adventure paths produced by Paizo, Inc., the Mythic Module Monsters series is designed just for you! Rather than having to hunt through multiple books trying to find the odd monster here or there to enhance your adventure path experience, you'll find the monsters introduced in that AP right here, ready to pick up exactly the issues you need to enhance the mythic monsters in your favorite adventure! You can pick them up a few at a time or collect an entire series for your favorite AP!

194621.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (March 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Why Character Optimisation is Pointless (Unless You Enjoy It)
194621.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible GM’s Resource by Creighton Broadhurst, Greg Marks, Christopher Wasko and Mike Welham

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

This month’s issue features:

House Rule: Identifying Monsters
Feyhall At A Glance (from Village Backdrop: Feyhall)
Prison Break: Prison Dressing (from Campaign Events: Prison Break)
Looting the Druid: Pouch Contents (from I Loot the Druid’s Body)




Why Character Optimisation is Pointless (Unless You Enjoy It)

rpg: In the Name of Titania Regina
194622.name: In the Name of Titania Regina
194622.description:
User summary:

Characters have five Attributes, including Guts, Style, Strength, Cunning, and Heroics. These Attributes have an associated "Stat", or numeric value, from 1-6. Stats are randomly generated but assigned to the Attributes by the player. Characters also have a Star Sign (e.g., Aquarius, Capricorn, etc.) which yields an exceptional power.

The game provides a series of random tables that can be used to generate adventures, either by choosing entries, randomly generating them, or just using the tables for inspiration.

194623.name: Asteroid Hideout
194623.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is a hollowed out asteroid used as hidden habitat complete with a small shipyard.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

194624.name: The Sprawl
194624.description:
From the Introduction:

The future. Dark. Dirty. Dangerous. You’re loners, punks and criminals, marginalised by society through birth, choice or violence. Parasites, living symbiotic existences in the shadows cast by the arcologies, feeding from the scraps dangled by the megacorporations and then scurrying back to the shadows to avoid their dismissive, destructive gaze. Those vast multinational corporations — “Zaibatsus”, some call them — squat over everything, pulling the strings, controlling the flow of money, information, goods, and people. Governments scamper around their feet, begging for scraps. Hydrophilic lubricious polymers and automated cleaners keep their arcologies shining amidst the grey-brown urban sprawl which surrounds them. Corporate financial muscle pushes people around the city like blood. The megacorporations. Humanity’s most successful artificial organism. Technology keeps changing, shifting, mutating -- it’s adapt or die. There’s a sticky film of information smeared over everything, a networked datasphere in service to the megacorps. Buy this. Obey that. Buy more. See, the corps aren’t satisfied with having it all. They want more, and the only way they can get it is by eating their own. For the megacorporations, espionage, theft, kidnapping and murder are just file folders in the system architecture of success. For you though, they’re rungs on the slippery ladder out of the caustic industrial air the rest of us breathe. Play your cards right and you’ll be set: reputation, money, credibility. Everything you want. Freedom. But one false step and they’ll take away everything. The corps don’t need you. They need people like you. Screw up and you’ll be replaced by the next mouthy punk with too much raw talent and bloody ambition and not enough smarts. Tread carefully. There’s plenty more like you out there in The Sprawl.

The Sprawl is a game of mission-based action in a gritty neon-and-chrome Cyberpunk future. You are the extended assets of vast multinational corporations, operating in the criminal underground, and performing the tasks that those multinationals can’t do -- or can’t be seen to do. You are deniable, professional and -- ultimately -- disposable.

This game contains adult themes and adult language.

You’re still here, punk? You want to play with the pros? Hit the heavy bag? Get some cred? You’ll need more smarts than the last guy.

Welcome to the future...

194625.name: Delta Green: Need to Know
194625.description:
From publisher blurb:

WELCOME TO THE APOCALYPSE

Born of the U.S. government’s 1928 raid on the degenerate coastal town of Innsmouth, Massachusetts, the covert agency known as Delta Green spent four decades opposing the forces of darkness with honor, but without glory. Stripped of sanction after a disastrous 1969 operation in Cambodia, Delta Green’s leaders made a secret pact: to continue their work without authority, without support, and without fear. Delta Green agents slip through the system, manipulating the federal bureaucracy while pushing the darkness back for another day—but often at a shattering personal cost.

In Delta Green: The Role-Playing Game, you are one of those agents. You’re the one they call when unnatural horrors seep into the world. You fight to keep cosmic evil from claiming human lives and sanity. You conspire to cover it all up so no one else must see what you’ve seen—or learn the terrible truths you’ve discovered.

The quickstart rulebook of DELTA GREEN: NEED TO KNOW includes everything you need to play Delta Green.

Complete rules for conducting investigations, overcoming crises, fighting for your life, and watching your sanity slip away.
Complete rules for character creation.
Six characters, ready to play.
A Delta Green operation, “Last Things Last,” ready for the Handler (the game moderator) to introduce your team to Delta Green tonight.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Party Game Nominee
194626.description:
Description from the publisher:

Happy Salmon is a simple, ultra-fast, very silly card game.

There are no turns. Players call out the action shown on their cards as fast as they can. When two players have a match, they celebrate by performing the action. Actions include the classic "High 5", the unifying "Pound It", the frantic "Switcheroo", and the delightful and bizarre "Happy Salmon".

Each time a player celebrates a match, they quickly discard a card. The first person to get rid of all their cards wins.

The "FIN-tastically" unique and cute fish pouch makes Happy Salmon perfect to take to camp, vacation or if you are just traveling upstream.
194626.name: Happy Salmon
boardgamepodcastepisode: #25: Scythe review & on tap; Brian Suhre interview (Coldwater Crown preview); Mergers & Buyouts, part 3
#26: Gen Con 2016 wrap-up and Interviews with Jamey Stegmaier & Sun King Brewing
#36: 2016, A Year in Review
Ep 036 – BGG Spring Con & Spiel des Jahres 2016 Nominees
Episode 120: Terraforming Mars, La Granja and The Hype Machine
Episode 29: Origins 2016 Recap
Episode 32 - Holiday Gift Giving Guide
Episode 34 : Scythe Review + Interview with Lance "Undead Viking" Myxter
Episode 42 :: Board Game of the Year 2016 - Brawling Brothers Awards
Episode 51 - Adventure Land
Episode 67 - The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire and OrcaCon 2017
Epside 35 :: The Others + On The Couch with Josh and Brandon
Happy Salmon Review with the Game Boy Geek
HLG 12: Schoencadeau
HLG 15: Geluk & Fillers
Mid-Week Mixup: ShushCon Recap!

194627.description:
From the publisher:

Do you remember how thrilled you were in history class, reading about legendary figures of ages past so you could present an exciting and engaging book report or term paper? We can't, either.

Instead, what if history could be fun? What if you could give George Washington a cannon and have him blast William Sherman into the next dimension? What if, rather than just reading about Annie Oakley's sharpshooting skill, you could actually GIVE her a rifle and have her snipe your opponent until s/he begs for mercy?

Now you can. You've heard of American History X? Well, this is American History Y -- as in Yuge battles! Heroes of History is an expandable card game that lets players use real-life people, weapons, battlegrounds, and items to battle each other for supremacy. Each card features professionally-drawn pictures of historical figures such as Tecumseh, Clara Barton, and Deborah Sampson; locations such as Saratoga, Little Bighorn, and Fort McHenry; and items such as the Winchester and Ben Franklin's Lightning Rod. It's a fun way to learn -- or an educational way to have fun.

Game play is simple. Each player takes turns drawing cards and playing Characters to the Trench. Players can also play Supply cards that have some temporary effects. They can also equip weapons to characters and play Battleground cards that give bonuses to all Characters in play for the player that has summoned them. Players begin with 50 State Points and take turns attacking each other until one player is reduced to 0 or a player runs out of cards to play.

Future sets will include Heroes from history as well as from mythology. What would happen if Thor faced off against Washington? What if Washington had Mjolnir and Thor had a bayonet? Only you know the answer to that.

Watch us:
With Board Game Geek TV at Origins https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8wRRARQURcY
Reviewed by The Dice Tower https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TSsYavyuphE
Reviewed by Rob Oren https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sxKpIguoIbk
Reviewed by My Little Smarty Pants https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W-wiXJ-Crrg
Reviewed by DDO Players http://ddoplayers.com/2016/06/16/ddo-players-reviews-heroes-...
Reviewed by Bower's Game Corner https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dCP1BMyBKJ0
194627.name: Heroes of History
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games

194628.name: DayTrippers Golden Age Adventures
194628.description:
An anthology of 16 roleplaying adventures based on "Golden Age" stories by famous science fiction writers of the 1930s-50s. Each adventure comes with three scenarios, allowing them to be easily dropped in to any science fiction roleplaying campaign. As with all DayTrippers products, conversion tables are provided for use with other game systems.

This 364-page book includes:
• 16 Adventure Modules
• 4 Death Worlds
• 7 Hexcrawls
• 48 Possible Missions
• New and Expanded Rules
• and the full text of all source stories

Take your Players into the fantastic and dangerous worlds envisioned in the short stories of sixteen science fiction greats:
• Poul Anderson
• Peter Bailey
• Philip K. Dick
• Paul Ernst
• Harry Harrison
• Henry Kuttner
• Alan E. Nourse
• H. Beam Piper
• Robert Sheckley
• Edwin K. Sloat
• R. F. Starzl
• Jack Vance
• Floyd L. Wallace
• Stanley G. Weinbaum
• Manly Wade Wellman
• Hal K. Wells

194629.name: Sausage Party
194629.description:
Sausage Party is a party game inspired by the Paul and Storm song from Learningtown.

In the game, each player has a deck of cards that feature different types of sausages, buns, and (on the bottom of the deck) a "last bun" card. Each player has three places in front of themselves where they'll cook sausages on the grill.

With everyone playing at the same time, you continually draw the top card from your deck and play it either on your grill or on someone else's. Once a type of sausage is in a grill slot, only more of that type of sausage — or mustard, which is wild _ can be played there. Once you (or someone else) places a bun on a sausage on your grill, you move it to your plate, making room for a new type of sausage on the grill. If your hand is empty, you can choose to trash all of the cards in one of your grill slots. Once someone plays their "last bun" card, the game ends.

Each type of sausage has a number on it, and if your bunned sausage has exactly that many cards (not counting the bun), then you score points equal to twice that number. If you have fewer cards, you score as many points as non-bun cards; if you have more cards, you score zero points for that sausage. Whoever has the most points wins!

194630.name: Investigation Squad
194630.description:
User summary:

Characters in this rules-light game are members of a law enforcement gang that confront, capture, or kill various violent criminals. Characters are defined by narrative traits only and action resolution strongly favors narrative decisions over random process. Dice rolls may be used but are simple and generally have a minor role in the game.

194631.description:
The classic game of trick or treat fun, rock n roll and fright!

Object: Be the first player to travel through the town of Wheary Falls by defeating all three monsters and arriving to the concert in one piece!

Gameplay: The Player whose birthday is closest to Halloween (October 31st) goes first, and then play continues clockwise around the table.

On your turn, roll the die and move your Character Pawn as directed. Then pick up one Fate Card from the CARDS pile and follow its direction. Now your turn is over. Place all used Fate Cards in a discard pile. Once all cards have been used, shuffle discard pile and begin using again.

Movement: Each Player should roll the six-sided die and then pick up a Fate Card on each turn, unless stated by a previous card.
Always move in the direction of the candy corn square pieces (the white tips point forward), unless a card directs you otherwise.

How To Win The Game: If you are the first Player to reach the concert ticket (FINISH), you've reached the Demon Inferno show and have won the game!

Optional Rules: Once you've mastered this classic game try a slightly more challenging version. Use the additional rules of either Easier Play, Choose Your Fate or Hard to Kill.
boardgameversion: Nevermore Production Toys, LLC first edition
194631.name: The Barn: The Board Game

194632.name: Operation Foole
194632.description:
User summary:

Operation Foole is set during the historic Berlin Airlift, on April 1, 1949. The game is almost entirely a storytelling narrative exercise between two players, though if something cannot be resolved with a narrative solution, a coin flip can be used. The game uses an unusual method to grant experience points.

194633.name: Kittens and Rainbows and ______
194633.description: Kittens and Rainbows and _____ is a party game of nice things and inspirational quotes. Players take turns judging other players' suggestions for how to complete an uplifting saying. Would it be better to say "Always aim for the moon. If you miss, you'll land among the bubble baths" -- or would you rather "land among the big burly bearded men having a tea party"?

194634.name: Revolution (2005)
194634.description:
User summary:

This rules-light game is designed for two players who take turns building a narrative history of a revolutionary event. Though inspired by revolutionary France, the rules are generic enough to be used with nearly any genre or time period. The game is played in a series of defined phases, in order to drive the narrative arc. Random events are determined with a simple d6 roll.

194635.name: Shriekwing
194635.description:
From the introduction:

At first glance Shriekwing is a terrifying green dragon, but those that survive a closer inspection discover the glowing red eyes and the whirring of gears from under the scales. Shriekwing is an artificially created clockwork dragon, made by the enigmatic dwarf archaeologist Lorin Dracht.

194636.description: 6-sided plastic dice with each face having illustrations from the Nuclear War game, including the classic Super Germ
194636.name: Nuclear War: Dice

194637.name: The sky is gray, and you are distressed
194637.description:
Publisher summary

Frank and Meg are close but their relationship is in trouble. 'The sky is gray, and you are distressed' is a 2-player freeform game that uses randomized secrets and semi-scripted questions to have a serious conversation about honesty and identity.
rpg: The sky is gray, and you are distressed
rpgpodcastepisode: 44 – The Sky Is Grey and You Are Distressed
Actual Play: 183 Days and The Sky is Grey and You Are Distressed

194638.name: Vip Vap
194638.description: Small dexterity game for children available (among other small toy prices) to loyal customers at GuldBageren - a Danish chain of bakeries. The game consists of a small cloth pouch containing: a wooden hemisphere (5.5 cm in diameter); a d6 die with sides in six different colors; six small painted wooden blocks of different shape, size, and color. The colors of the small blocks correspond to the sides of the die. Rules are printed on the pouch. On turn, a player rolls the die and then has to place the small block of the corresponding color on the wooden hemisphere. If the increasingly loaded hemisphere tilts such that the small blocks drop off, the player lose the game.

194640.name: Under My Bed
194640.description:
In Under My Bed, most of the players at the table will take on the roles of monsters. One player is secretly a kid in a monster costume however, and they are trying to figure out which monster is hiding underneath their bed.

Under My Bed is a microgame in which players take turns asking one another questions until either the monsters figure out which player is the kid, or the kid can determine which monster is under their bed. The same question cannot be asked twice in the same game, and while the kid can lie as much as they like, the monsters are forced to tell some version of the truth.

194641.name: Savagery (2005)
194641.description:
User summary:

Characters in this rules-light game are generally mundane people with few (if any) outstanding aspects. They live ordinary lives and go about pursuing banal, and often trivial, goals. Often, goals are achieved through petty vindictiveness on others.

The game contemplates a fair amount of violence, both physical and emotional, though the focus primarily is about the emotional battle.

194643.name: The Gentlemen's Entomology Club
194643.description:
From the introduction:

In this game you take on the character of a member of The Gentlemen's Entomology Club for a meeting. Your character will spend the evening imbibing wine and impressing their peers with stories of his entomological expeditions. The accounts will be comical, with absurd events and unlikely references to philosophical ideas. During the game you will find yourself telling tall tales, acting as a judge of a story and challenging the storyteller with accusations of lying and by inventing troublesome situations.

194644.name: Transmutation (2005)
194644.description:
From the introduction:

The essence of the world of Transmutation are the six elements from which it is composed. Unlike most elemental traditions, these elements do not form a single cycle. Instead they form a hierarchy of relationships. These elements are present in the physical world, but they also represent outcomes for different actions taken by characters.

194645.name: The Last Supper (2005)
194645.description:
From the introduction:

The game itself is modeled on a historical religious custom called an agape feast, which was essentially a potluck worship feast. This feast was similar to, but predates, the use of Communion as a ceremony. Plan amongst yourselves for a lengthy, leisurely meal, with dishes that you will all enjoy. Each player should bring a fair share of the food. We strongly encourage that as much of the cooking as possible be done by the players, rather than using store-bought items. Even players who can't normally cook can probably follow a recipe, make a salad, or the like.

User summary:

The game begins with a religious disclaimer. In the game, the game master assumes the role of Jesus Christ and the remaining players are His apostles. Play revolves around Christ being unable clearly to explain His doctrine.

194646.name: The Last Supper Cards and Board
194646.description:
User summary:

The Last Supper uses Doctrine Cards, Mission Cards, and a seating Board during play. The cards drive the narrative arc and the board tracks progress. These game items are provided as three print-and-play PDF documents:


Board (17" x 11")
Doctrine Cards (8 cards, printed 20 times each for a deck of 160)
Mission Cards (18 cards)

194647.description:
This is 2 more promotional Council Members for the game Council of Blackthorn. These were stretch goals that were unlocked during the crowd-funding campaign that all backers will receive.

The Black Widow allows you to spy on your opponents' treasonous activities while the Admiral Prestige can gamble you to riches...or ruin!
194647.name: Council of Blackthorn: Council Member Expansion Pack

194649.name: Barquest!
194649.description:
User summary:

In Barquest! characters have four Attributes: Physical, Emotional, Intellectual, and Psychological/Psychic. Each Attribute has an associated numeric value from 1-8, randomly generated. Each Attribute has a further Skill (selected form a list of four per Attribute) associated with it, in which the character particularly is useful. The game takes place entirely inside of a medieval drinking establishment, with "quests" being things like gambling, dancing, or defending a woman's honor. The game uses random floor tile placement to create the bar, then the game master fills it with non-player characters. The game provides numerous pre-generated characters to further speed play.

194650.name: Guilty Before God
194650.description:
"We are murderers, a nation of murderers"

User summary:

Character creation involves a round-robin selection of dice from a large common pool. As characters select dice they announce why they are selecting that type (each type is associated with a particular aspect of character). After all dice are selected, play begins. Action involves developing various perceived insults to honor, issuing challenges to duels, arranging duels (seconds, weapons, terms, etc.), and then executing the duels. During play, players may expend dice from their selected pools to attempt to influence narrative development.

194651.name: Invincible! (2005)
194651.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are all Khans, leaders of the Mongol Horde. They have several Modes (roughly, Attributes) with numeric Ratings. The various Modes describe methods the Khan uses to interact with followers, and include: Companion, Accuser, Informer, Leader, and Honor. Play proceeds atypically, in structured phases, with character selecting proscribed moves to execute during each phase. Some actions result in Rating points being transferred between characters.

Several aspects of the game mechanics are fairly confusing; examples of play unfortunately are not provided.

194652.name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – Yokosuka D4Y Suisei
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War
194652.description:
From the publisher:

The Yokosuka D4Y Suisei, nicknamed “Judy” by the Allies, was a capable dive bomber serving the Imperial Japanese Navy. Inspired to the German He.118, the D4Y design was lighter, stronger, more advanced in its structure and aerodynamics, and this airplane was used in all of the most famous battles of the Pacific. The D4Y was very fast, greatly appreciated quality for a dive–bomber, but some reliability problems with the engine slowed its use. The D4Y was also used with success as a reconnaissance aircraft and for kamikaze missions.

Yokosuka D4Y1 (Yokosuka Kokutai)
Belonging to the famous Yokosuka Kokutai, this airplane led the defense of its homeland during the last months of war.

Yokosuka D4Y1 Suisei (Kokutai 121)
Kokutai 121 fought during Battles of the Marianas, showing pride and courage, yet suffered great losses during the Battle for Peleliu.

Yokosuka D4Y3 Suisei (Kokutai 601)
Kokutai 601 fought aggressively in the Battles for the Philippines, the largest carrier–to–carrier battle in WW2 and a turning point of the war.

Each WW2 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product.

194653.name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – Republic P-47D Thunderbolt
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War
194653.description:
From the publisher:

The Republic P–47 was by far the largest and heaviest single engine fighter built in the entire World War Two. Nicknamed “the Unbreakable” and “the Jug,” it was a rugged and dependable airplane, capable of flying its pilot back from combat even when full of holes from enemy fire. Heavily armed with eight .50-caliber machine guns, and carrying an impressive bomb load, it was very effective as both a bomber escort and a ground attack aircraft. Refined during his development, the P–47D was the most produced version, with 12,602 built.

Republic P–47D Thunderbolt (Mohrle)
Flying in European skies, Lt. Charles D. Mohrle completed 97 combat missions and was a highly decorated pilot.

Republic P–47D Thunderbolt (RAF 135 Squadron)
This fighting squadron, reformed in 1941, fought against the Japanese Empire, earning honor and glory on the Burma front.

Republic P–47D Thunderbolt (Raymond)
Lt. Elwood D. Raymond was a member of the 56th Fighter Group, stationed in England, which destroyed more enemy aircraft than any other did.

Each WW2 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product.

194654.name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – Messerschmitt Bf.109 K-4
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War
194654.description:
From the publisher:

The Messerschmitt Bf.109 was one of the first truly modern fighters of WW2. Originally conceived as an interceptor, the Bf.109 fulfilled multiple roles, as bomber escort, fighter-bomber, ground–attack aircraft, and reconnaissance aircraft. The final production version of the Bf.109 was the K series, or “Kurfürst.” Externally similar to the G series, it had a large number of internal and aerodynamic changes that improved its effectiveness and remedied existing flaws, which kept it competitive against rival fighters.

Messerschmitt Bf.109 K–4 (9./JG3)
Belonging to the proud Jagdgeschwader 9, which fought throughout the war, this Bf.109 defended German borders from the Allied advance.

Messerschmitt Bf.109 K–4 (1./JG77)
Jagdgeschwader 77 used the last version of Bf.109 to fight in the Reichsverteidigung (defense of the Reich) during the last days of WW2, to slow the inevitable German defeat.

Messerschmitt Bf.109 K–4 (Hartmann)
Major Erich Hartmann, the greatest Ace of all time with 352 aerial victories, piloted many different airplanes, including the latest versions of Bf.109.

Each WW2 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product.

194655.description:
Santorini is a non-abstract re-imagining of the 2004 edition. Since its original inception over 30 years ago, Santorini has been endlessly developed, enhanced and refined by mathematician and educator, Dr. Gordon Hamilton.

Santorini is a highly accessible pure strategy game that is simple enough for an elementary school classroom. But with enough gameplay depth and content for even hardcore gamers to explore, Santorini is truly a game for everyone. The rules are deceptively simple. Each turn consists of 2 steps:

1. Move - move one of your builders into a neighboring space. You may move your Builder Pawn on the same level, step-up one level, or step down any number of levels.

2. Build - Then construct a building level adjacent to the builder you moved. When building on top of the third level, place a dome instead, removing that space from play.

Winning the game - If either of your builders reaches the third level, you win.

Variable player powers - What makes Santorini truly special is its seamless integration of variable player powers into a pure-strategy game. Dr Hamilton has designed over 40 thematic god and hero powers, each fundamentally changing the way the game is played.
194655.name: Santorini
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
boardgamepodcastepisode: #36: 2016, A Year in Review
#37: Santorini review; Evolution: Climate on tap; Unlock! First Impressions
#39: Two Player Games six-pack; Citrus on tap; Isle of Skye & Avenue
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 016 – Quadropolis vs Suburbia
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 039 – Top 10 Mechanisms
Episode 21 - Puttin' On the Blitz
Episode 24: One Year Anniversary - Jamie Keagy of The Secret Cabal
Episode 37 - Our 2016 Enthusiastic Seals of Approval!
Episode 68 - Adrenaline
Episode 92- Barcelona: The Rose of Fire plus Gloomhaven Contest
HLG 17: First Class & Bordspelgeluiden
Perfect Information Podcast Episode 32 - The very best games of 2016
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 156
Vox Republica 134: Teeny Santorini
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 70!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 75

194656.name: Apokalypsis
194656.description:
Apokalypsis takes the players back to the Ancient Greece. As the wrath of the Gods fall upon you, you must interpret the omens and foresee which parts of the island that will remain safe and which parts that are doomed.

The wrath of the Gods causes the island of Thera to sink tile by tile. The players now struggle to interpret the omens and move onto safe land. The player or players with the most survivors at the end of the game wins.

The game is played with three basic components:
