2016 Golden Joystick Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Steam Awards Best Use Of A Farm Animal Nominee
2016 Steam Awards I Thought This Game Was Cool Before It Won An Award Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee
2017 British Academy Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee
2017 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Honorable Mention
2017 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
2017 SXSW Best New IP of the Year Nominee
194926.description:
Stardew Valley is an open-ended country-life RPG.

You’ve inherited your grandfather’s old farm plot in Stardew Valley. Armed with hand-me-down tools and a few coins, you set out to begin your new life. Can you learn to live off the land and turn these overgrown fields into a thriving home? It won’t be easy. Ever since Joja Corporation came to town, the old ways of life have all but disappeared. The community center, once the town’s most vibrant hub of activity, now lies in shambles. But the valley seems full of opportunity. With a little dedication, you might just be the one to restore Stardew Valley to greatness!

Source: The Game Website.

194927.name: Hungry Giraffe
194927.description:
It sucks when you're hungry. Sometimes you just want to bury your face into a burger, or tear into a taco. Out on the African savannah, a Hungry Giraffe feels your pain.

A 20 foot tall, 1200kg animal like the giraffe needs to chow down on tons of food each day, just to stay alive. But, oh no! All the tastiest leaves have been eaten, while up in the sky endless quantities of snacks, fruit and junk food hover just out of reach!

Hungry Giraffe features the world's largest and hungriest even-toed ungulate. Through skilful steering of his neck, you can propel your half-starved giraffe on his twisty-turny upward journey, chomping on strawberries, fries, sandwiches and naughtier treats.

But beware! The skies are also strewn with hazards. Poison, Anvils and non-prescription Drugs also hover up there, ready to send unwary giraffes plummeting to earth.

Hungry Giraffe is by FAR the greatest giraffe-feeding game of all time! Dare you miss out?

Source: The Developer Website.

194928.name: Side-Swap
194928.description:
Side-Swap is an abstract strategy game with similarities to Checkers. The pieces start on squares of the opposite color and have to cross the board to their home area on the other side, at which time they can move onto squares of their own color; after they do this they cannot move again. All pieces can be jumped and jumps can be chained. Opposing pieces can only be captured once they have moved onto their color spaces.

The game can be played by two players, four players in partnerships, or four players individually. When playing with four the pieces are turned over to show numbers; pieces must end up on the spaces with matching numbers. The four-individuals game has a few extra rules about when pieces of the same color may be captured.

194929.name: Steal the Cookie
194929.description:
Do you like gnomes? Do you like cookies?? Then prepare yourself for the most EPIC CARD GAME EVER! Steal the Cookie is a fast paced, intense party card game. The object of the game is to be the last player with the Almighty Cookie in your hand, when the final Cookie Jar Card is drawn.

The game consists of three types of cards... Action cards, Stop Cards, and Interrupt Cards. Each player must use the cards in his hand to prevent the other players from obtaining the cookie. The game is easy to learn, but hard to master. Use all of your skills to overcome your opponents and steal the COOKIE! But watch out! Your opponents have an array of spells and tricks up their sleeve! The object of the game is to be the last player to be holding the Almighty Cookie when the final Cookie Jar card is drawn. The game is fast, simple, and incredibly easy to learn. There are over 20 different card types for endless hours of fun! So grab your friends and family and get ready to STEAL THE COOKIE!

194930.name: Goat Simulator - MMO Simulator
194930.description:
You no longer have to fantasize about being a simulated goat in a simulated MMO, your dreams have finally come true!

Features

Five different classes: Warrior, Rouge, Magician, Hunter and Microwave
Complete dozens of quests, level up a hundred times and play five different classes that’s a ton of content you do the math
Level cap is 101, 1 level higher than you-know-what
There are even elves and dwarves like in that movie
Stay a while and listen to Dumblebore the Grey in Twistram




Source: The Game Website.

194931.name: Goat Simulator: The Bundle
194931.description:
User Summary

European exclusive physical bundle of Goat Simulator, its expansions, and DLC.

194933.name: Horrors of the Aboleth
194933.description:
Publisher Blurb:

“Just when you thought it was safe to adventure in the water!”

Aboleth are an empire of entirely inhuman intelligences who are older, smarter, and more vile than most land-based races. This book assumes that a race as old and powerful as aboleth, and as prone to manipulating and transmogrifying other races, is going to have a great deal more in their empire than just their core race and skum servants.

We present a wide range of noisome and disquieting new threats, ready to turn their alien intellects to the destruction of the PCs’ world. So prepare to behold the behemoth, face the slime golems, and flee the tentacle crabs. Nothing can save you now.

194934.description:
We’ve just arrived at 221B Baker Street when Dr. Watson takes us aside. "Gentlemen, I’m deeply concerned about Mr. Holmes’s mental state. For two days now he’s been acquiring strange books and spending all his time at the coffee table playing patience with a deck of cards. I’m worried that he’s been seized by the idea of reading the future thus, which you will no doubt agree is quite illogical. Also, please don’t mention this madness of not speaking until he’s flipped a card."

Wiggins asks Watson if he can say when exactly the most brilliant mind of our time was overcome with this folly. "Precisely two days ago, after reading The Times." Wiggins looks over at us conspiratorially and whispers in our ear: "I rather think we’d do well to read that edition of the Times and start investigating, don’t you?"

So begins "October 1891," a single extra case expansion originally published in Role Mag' (#5 - March-April 1991).

An alternate main case title was added to the English and Spanish editions:
* Spanish: El Caso de la Baraja
* English: Case of Bad Fortunes
194934.name: Sherlock Holmes Détective Conseil: Octobre 1891

194935.name: The Domesday Book (Volume 3, Issue 5 - Summer 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Designing a Quasi-Feudal Society for C&C, Part I
A Touch of Class: The Ghostwalker
What is Old is New Again!
194935.description:
Table of Contents

Foreword:
What is Old is New Again!

Editorial:
Once More Unto the Breach

Feature:
Designing a Quasi-Feudal Society for C&C - Part I

A Touch of Class:
The Ghostwalker

The Muse’s Market:
Gnomish Healing Brandy
Shroud of Grafting

A Hunter’s Bestiary:
Maze Monster

Reviews:
Classic Monsters

Additional Credits & OGL

194936.name: The Domesday Book (Volume 3, Issue 6 - Fall 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Designing a Quasi-Feudal Society for C&C, Part II
The Seven Treasures of the Overlords of Order & The Seven Implements of Chaos
A Touch of Class: The Harlequin
194936.description:
Table of Contents

Foreword:
The Changing Season

Editorial:
Big Business

Feature:
Designing a Quasi-Feudal Society for C&C - Part II

A Touch of Class:
The Harlequin

The Muse’s Market:
Leschemocy
Parmenian’s Armor
Polydamas’s Manual

7 Treasures & 7 Implements

A Hunter’s Bestiary:
Briarlings, Common & Corrupt
Catbat & Batlynx

Reviews:
Amazing Adventures

Additional Credits & OGL

194937.name: Tornado
194937.description:
From the back of the box:

200 feet. 600 knots. Adrenaline off the scale.

The Tornado aircraft is an unmatched combination of speed and lethal fire power. Now, Digital Integration is proud to present TORNADO - unsurpassed by any flight simulator to date. Options range from ground-based simulator training to multi-aircraft multi-mission campaigns involving a vast array of aircraft and ground vehicles. With design input from RAF aircrew and British Aerospace, TORNADO is unequalled in authenticity. DI's expertise gives you a richly detailed landscape and depth of gameplay. The choice is yours - go it alone or take the squadron and discover what real Tornado pilots mean by a "target rich environment"…

Features of TORNADO:
- simulator training, combat & multi-mission campaigns
- 2 seat cockpit - pilot and navigator/weapons officer
- GP bombs, cluster bombs, JP233, ALARM, air-to-air missiles and more!
- multi-aircraft coordinated attacks
- laser designated bombs with pin-point accuracy
- authentic landing and avionics
- sophisticated mission planning system
- rolling landscapes with extensive natural and man-made features
- night flying and low visibility options
- autopilot includes terrain following and nab/attack systems
- 2 player option for head-to-head dogfight

194938.name: Automobilová soutěž
194938.description:
Czech board game about rally racing.
Players roll the dice and drive through track that consists of 3 stages. Every stage has speed trials, precise stops, failure traps and other tasks that can cause penalties to player. When all players finish stage, next one can start. Players count their penalties in the finish of race. Winner is player with the least penalties.

194939.name: Switchcars
194939.description:
Switchcars is a vehicular roguelike arcade set in a broken spacetime. Escape alien beasts over procedural environments, using more than 1,000 vehicles.

Source: The Game Website.

194940.name: Tatort: Das Spiel
194940.description: Trivia game about the german Tv-Series "Tatort"

194941.name: Story Of the Survivor
194941.description:
User Summary

Action RPG set in a zombie apocalypse. It's not just the zombies you need to watch out for other survivors, food and drink too.

194942.name: Searchers of Mystara
194942.description:
From the initial blurb:

Searchers of Mystara is an adaptation of Nicholas Dessaux's "Searchers of the Unknown," designed for starting an old school game in the northern reaches of Mystara. It should be particularly good at creating a "funnel" experience and helping players come up with characters that will feel at home in the campaign world. Although you could use it to run an entire campaign for years on end, you'll probably want to switch to a more fleshed out game after a few sessions.

194943.name: Captain America in: The Doom Tube of Dr. Megalomann
194943.description:
Players take on the role of Marvel superhero Captain America and must guide him around the Doom Tube base of Dr Megalomann. The base is a long tube inside another tube, splitting areas up into chambers around a central core. The virus has been released into the base, and players can only access areas below their immunity level. By defeating enemies they can collect ying-yang which boosts their immunity. Captain America can throw his shield to take out enemies, but the number of shields he holds are limited, although he can re-use those which kill enemies or if he recalls a shield before it is lost. As the player moves Captain America around areas they need to recover parts of a password which will allow them access into the final area to disable the missiles. The game is played in real time, giving the player only one hour in which to complete the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Captain America in: The Doom Tube of Dr. Megalomann", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

194944.name: Battle Isle Data Disk I
videogamedeveloper: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
videogamepublisher: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
194944.description:
User summary:

This expansion for the turn-based strategy game Battle Isle contains 32 new maps (24 single player and 8 multiplayer) and two new landscape types (desert and ice).

194945.name: Crynosaurs
194945.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Open world single player action/adventure FPS game with an original story and some basic survival elements. You play as a human who is stuck in a dangerous prehistoric world and will need to find a way home. The aim is to have a realistic look to the game.

Source: The Game Website.

194947.name: Mixed Nuts
194947.description:
Mixed Nuts is a party/trivia game with a unique voting element. Each of the trivia cards is double-sided with a question on both sides and the answer to each question on the opposite side; therefore, the person reading the question can play along, too. Each card features an odd trivia fact—and somewhere in the text, there are two possible choices—one is a fact, the other is a fib (these choices are a different color than the rest of the text).

The active player picks one (the fact or the lie), and reads the sentence aloud to the other players. Here's an example: “Al Capone's vault was opened on live TV by (Barbara Walters/Geraldo Rivera) and there was virtually nothing of value in it.” Players then decide if the given answer was correct. For instance, the active player includes “Barbara Walters” in their statement. If a player thinks that's right, they put the voting chip in their hand. If a player thinks that’s incorrect, they put nothing in their hand and have an empty hand. All players then reveal what's in their hand. The correct answer is “Geraldo Rivera,” so those players with empty hands receive one point—in the form of a nut—to put into their score cup. After three rounds of each player having had a turn to read a card, the player with the most nuts wins.

194948.description:
With the shopping cart in the supermarket. Where is the shelf with the bananas or the milk? Colored chits have to be sorted into the correct shelves and counters, before they can be added to the cart and paid at the checkout.

The main game is a memory variant, in which the players don't have to find pairs; instead, they need to find food items that match the colored spaces in their shopping basket.

In addition, there are several simple rules for play whith very young childs: just naming the various objects, sorting the items into she correct shelves, moving them around with the plastic shopping cart, buying their favourite dish ...
194948.name: Komm, wir kaufen ein

194949.name: Asterix Der Gallier
194949.description:
von www.ludorium.at (German)

Lauf/Würfelspiel mit Ereigniskärtchen,

Wer dran ist würfelt beide Würfel, sucht einen für Asterix aus und zieht Asterix. Dann stellt er die Drehscheibe auf die Würfelzahl von Asterix, nun kann Obelix ziehen. Für beide gelten die in den Löchern neben den Feldern auftauchenden Ereignisse, wenn die Figuren auf einem zum Loch gehörigen Feld stehen. Am Ende gibt es Punkte für die Reihenfolge des Zieleinlaufs und für gesammelte Gegenstände von Zaubertrank bis Hinkelstein.

Lauf/Würfelspiel * 2-4 Spieler ab 5 Jahren * * 601/2820, Noris, Deutschland * noris SPIELE * Georg Reulein GmbH & Co KG



from page www.ludorium.at (Google translation)Running / dice game with cards Event,
You roll the die both dice, looking for a made for Asterix and pulls Asterix. Then he asks the hub to the dice number of Asterix, Obelix now can pull. For both the emerging in the holes next to the fields Events apply if the figures are on a the hole associated field. At the end, there are points for the order of finish and collected items of potion to menhir.

Running / dice game * 2-4 players, ages 5 * 601/2820, Noris, Germany * noris GAMES * Georg Reulein GmbH & Co KG

boardgameimplementation: The House of the Flying Blades
194950.description:
The Pyramid of the Flying Marbles is a Shibumi game for 3 players derived from The House of the Flying Blades, by the same designer.

Players take turns capturing a marble of the next player in turn or passing. When all players pass in succession the game ends. The player with more marbles remaining on the board wins.
194950.name: The Pyramid of the Flying Marbles

194951.name: Tarrakian Monsters
194951.description:
From the introduction:

This [product] contains thirty monsters from the World of Tarrak, ready to enter your fantasy world.
...
Presented in the Popular Compendium Format.

User summary:

The first printing was titled "Fantasy Monsters", later printings were titled "Tarrakian Monsters". The product otherwise was identical, even using the same product code. While advertised as compatible with "any fantasy roleplaying game", the format and content was squarely aimed at Advanced Dungeons & Dragons, 2nd Edition.

194952.description:
Mauseschlau and Bärenstark want to recover a treasure from a ship wreck deep in the ocean. But the diving is not without risks. There are aggressive sharks, and a mysterious creature guards the wreck. By he who can answer questions and perform tasks related to ships and oceans, and has a little luck with the dice, will be first to bring his treasure to safety.

It is a roll-and-move game where the players follow a track through the sea, from the ship to the diving bell, from there to the ship wreck, and upwards to the surface.

On many spaces, a question related to the sea will be asked; younger childs can select between three answers on the card, older ones have to find the answer without help. On other spaces, a small pantomime is requested. In both cases, oxygen tanks can be won. These are needed on the shark spaces. Without air, the player has to retreat to the diving bell.

When reaching or passing the wreck, the player gets a piece of the treasure.

On addition to sharks, the area between the ship wreck and the surface is guarded by a plastic Kraken. It is moved by a special die, and if it catches a diver with treasure, the treasure is lost, and the player is send back to the diving bell. When a player reaches the surface with a treasure, he wins the game.

Changes to the precursor (Mauseschlau & Bärenstark: Abenteuer unter Wasser) include: Less shark spaces, especially in the last part after the ship wreck; an additional die for the kraken, so the players can move the kraken in addition to their own playing piece; the treasure is easier to get, since the wreck no longer needs to be reached with the exact die roll; a variant is included to make it easier to leave the sea with the treasure. As a result, this revised game plays in half the time, and has less luck of the dice.
194952.name: Mauseschlau & Bärenstark: Meeresabenteuer

194954.name: Fated Minions of the Source
194954.description:
Publisher Website Blurb:

What is it like to be a monster? The Source is sometimes regarded as a fairy tale, some kind of bogeyman figure created to scare young gods into falling in line. The Outsiders know the truth however… the Source is returning and bringing the Coming Storm with it. Fated Minions of the Source is the second sourcebook for Part-Time Gods of Fate and reveals the mysteries of this elusive entity, as well as the many monsters and creatures who revere or detest its very existence.

194955.name: Coal & Parchment
rpg: Quill: A Letter-Writing Roleplaying Game for a Single Player
194955.description:
From the introduction:

Coal & Parchment is about dwarves writing letters to one another. In the Homes, quills and ink are rather rare commodities. However, paper isn’t too widely used and so stores remain generally well-stocked. Your average dwarf is too busy working or drinking or eating or chatting to write much - dwarves would just as soon go and visit their auntie as write her. The Keepers always write and have always written and will always write. It is the only way to keep down those many notions that parade through their minds all day long.

194956.name: Mud Wrestling
194956.description:
From the introduction:

Wrestling is a favored pastime around the world, both in real life and in fantasy games. While some societies make wrestling into a grand and formal institution, the common folk have a simple and unified alternative: mud wrestling. Mud wrestling is an ideal challenge for use in 1-on-1 campaigns and duels, party down-time, and as side-track during a larger adventure. Using this article, you can orchestrate a mud wrestling tournament or launch into spontaneous matches on the fly. This article also features a template, NPCs, and monsters for romping in the mud!

194957.name: Munchkin: Playmat – Spyke Gets Suckered
194957.description: Munchkin Playmat: Spyke Gets Suckered is a 28"×14" playmat that showcases Spyke tussling with a tentacled terror. It includes spots to keep track of your Class, Race, level, and all your monster-slaying gear, and it features an in-game bonus — Spyke's secret space — that allows you to Cheat! one item per game.

194958.name: Munchkin Playmat: Flower Cashes In
194958.description: Munchkin Playmat: Flower Cashes In is a 28"×14" playmat that showcases Flower atop a pile of freshly looted items. It includes spots to keep track of your Class, Race, level, and all your monster-slaying gear, and it features an in-game bonus that gives you extra gold when you sell items each turn...but not forever.

194959.name: Devil Daggers
194959.description:
Inspired by 1990s FPS and arcade games, Devil Daggers is a fast-paced shooter that places you in an abyssal arena to face endless legions of demons. Armed with versatile magic daggers and a fluid movement system, fight to survive as long as you can. Compete for precious seconds with Steam Friends or on global leaderboards.Your spirit and skill will be tested.

Source: The Publisher Website.

194960.name: Brain Games
194960.description:
Challenge your brain! See how you stack up in 4 mind-bending categories.

National Geographic Channel's Brain Games unlocks the science behind the mysteries of why we say, see, feel, and act the way we do! Whether you're going HEAD-TO-HEAD against another player or playing solo, you will discover loopholes in YOUR perception of REALITY.

In Brain Games, players take turns rolling a die to move 1-3 spaces and then try to pass the mind-bending challenge from the category (Logic, Language, Vision, or Mind & Body) they landed on to earn a token. The first player to get a token in each category wins the game! But be careful, the Head-To-Head challenges make you choose an opponent to take the challenge with but only the winner gets the token.

194961.name: Somnium Void
194961.description:
A Space Opera Setting for Unbelievably Simple Roleplaying

From the introduction:

One hundred billion citizens of the galaxy all saw it. The vision flashed before them for mere seconds, but what they saw stuck with them ever since. A black ship over a white moon. This seemingly innocuous image became burnt onto the brain of every man, woman and child across the galaxy. The event became known as the Somnium. Life would never be the same again.

194962.name: Grin Custom Playing Cards
194962.description:
Publisher blurb:

A set of cards designed to augment the Horror RPG Grin.

These specially made cards are crafted to enhance Grin's ambiance and suspense.

User summary:

Although Grin can be played with a standard pack of French cards, this accessory yields a more immersive game.

194964.description:
Backstory

The great Space Disagreement of 5406 has forced your entire colony to flee into the dark depths of outer space. You’re not alone. Other colonies too seek refuge from the war. All scramble to harvest the valuable resources on undiscovered planets. Your mission: destroy all other colonies. Diplomacy is boring. Shoot first, confirm if they were enemies later...

Mothership is a miniature space fleet game where 2 - 6 players take turns moving ships, attacking other players and managing an economy.

It simplifies regular war-gaming to be easier to learn, quicker to play but still keeping depth and strategy.

The main feature is a control panel which is used to alter the stats of each player's most versatile ship, the Mothership.
194964.name: Mothership: Tabletop Combat
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 40 - Isaac Childres and Gloomhaven
Interview Special #5: Peter Sanderson (Mothership)
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 160

194965.name: Top Hat
194965.description:
User Summary

2D Action platformer in the style of the old NES games. You have to make your way across 7 worlds in search of your stolen golden top hat.

194966.name: Among Thieves
194966.description:
Among Thieves is a fast-paced card game of thievery, cunning and dishonorable deeds.

Each player takes the role of a thief, trying to prove his superiority over the others by amassing a greater fortune. Everyone starts with the same set of action cards and each turn selects two, placing them face-down in front of him. Then, starting with the Acting Master Thief (first player), all players take turns in revealing one of their cards and completing its effect. This is repeated for the second card. At the end of the round, if there is no winner, all players discard one action card and play continues in the same fashion.

Every action differs from the others - some allow you to gain gold by robbing innocent citizens, some let you sabotage the plans of other players, and - of course - one of the actions enables you to steal directly from the fortunes of other players.

Among Thieves is a game of constant interaction between players, offers a unique mixture of strategy and intuition, and gives you the chance to prove once and for all to your friends who the real Master Thief is.

194967.name: Reflections
194967.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Reflections is a real-world adventure game where every action you take has meaningful consequences that radically shape the experience. Using physical interactions with the environment, everything you do can be woven into the narrative. The game's unique color mechanic flushes the black and white environment with color for each meaningful action, illustrating your progress and providing clues to what your future might hold.
You create the story - The powerful Storyteller engine watches everything you do and changes the experience to suit.
Three Acts - Experience various moments in your life which differ radically based on what you choose to do.
Dynamic progression - time passes as you play, changing the opportunites and events that unfold
Full environment interactivity - If you want to do it, you probably can. Reflections isn't about sitting and watching. Everything has its use.
AI that responds to you - Multiple characters and creatures to build relationships with, relationships that may last your whole life
Beautiful environments - stark black and white environments that slowly get filled with color by your actions
Fully supports the Oculus Rift

Source: The Game Website.

194968.name: Hrady
194968.description:
Czech game with large board full of castles and paths.
Players recruit one knight every turn, position of new knight is controlled by dice. After that players can move to consolidate power of knights to groups or fight for castles or other groups/knights or avoid conflicts etc. If someone wins battle for castle chooses carefully hidden defense power of castle (becouse it is limited per player).
Game ends when there is only last free castle. Players sum their castle points and player with the most wins.

194969.name: Star
194969.description:
Star is a two-player abstract strategy game designed by Ea Ea as the third out of four games by him extending or generalizing Hex. The four games in publication order: The Game of Y, Poly-Y, Star, and *Star. See further details of the developmental history at the designer's homepage.

The game board for Star is a hexagon with uneven side lengths made up of hexagonal spaces (e.g. alternating edge length of 6 and 7 hexes). On the board, the playing area is surrounded by a ring of "partial edge hexagons" used for final scoring. The two players (black and white) takes turns to place one stone (in their color) on any un-occupied hex space in the playing area. The goal of the game is to create "stars" - groups of connected stones belonging to one player that touches at least three partial edge hexagons. Each star has a score of the number of partial edge hexagons it touches minus two. The final score of a player is the sum of points for all the stars of that players color. The player with the highest score wins. The sum of the two players score is constant for any particular board.

From Wikipedia:
Star is a two-player abstract strategy board game developed by Craige Schensted (now Ea Ea). It was first published in 1983 in Games magazine. It is a connection game, related to games such as Hex, Y, Havannah, and TwixT. Unlike these games, however, the result is based on a player having a higher final score rather than achieving a specific goal. He has since developed a slightly more complicated version called *Star with better balance between edge and center moves, writing "*Star is what those other games wanted to be."

194970.name: Death House
194970.description:
From introduction:

You can run Curse of Strahd for 1st-level characters with the help of this optional mini-adventure, which is designed to advance characters to 3rd level. Before the characters can explore the haunted townhouse known as Death House, you need to guide them to the village of Barovia. The “Creeping Fog” adventure hook in chapter 1 works best, as it introduces few distractions.

Once the characters arrive in Strahd’s domain, steer them to the village. For the duration of this introductory adventure, any attempt by the characters to explore other locations in Strahd’s domain causes the mists of Ravenloft to block their path.

194971.name: Portsmouth 1745: Setting
194971.description:
From publisher blurb:

The year is 1745. The lure of open land, religious freedom, and riches to be made has drawn you away from your home in England to the New World. Unbeknownst to those who usher you across the Atlantic, your desires are more than what the authorities may find appropriate.

You like to delve into the world of the unknown. Your curiosity has led you to an underground world that hides beneath everyone’s nose. Rumors abound of the Indian shamans that can teach you new things, as long as they deem you worthy, or of the treasures waiting to be discovered. Relics of times long gone lie in wait, housing unimaginable power. Tomes of esoteric lore are said to dwell within shelters only accessible through hazardous terrain. But you don’t let silly rumors keep you from the occult power you seek. You are determined to uncover the secrets of centuries past and harness their dark powers.

However, many beings stand in your way, and the journey is not without peril. There are Templars to avoid, witch hunters to fight, natives to exterminate, and worse. It is said creatures of evil powers lurk across the New World, protecting the esoteric knowledge of centuries past and doing everything they can to keep their lands free of intruders. Your quests will not be easy, and scrutiny will be constant, but the payoff can be huge. For those who hold the power of the occult may hold the power to change the future.

This is the New World, and you are here to exploit its true secrets.

This is Colonial Gothic.

Portsmouth 1745: Setting is an extract of the 1745 New England setting content from the full Portsmouth 1745 campaign, licensed for use with Colonial Gothic (available from Rogue Games). This extract is designed for players involved in the campaign, players who want additional character options, and GMs wishing to use the setting but not the full campaign.

Portsmouth 1745: Setting includes:

New character options.
New spells and the introduction of dark magic.
A detailed gazetteer of New England in 1745, centered on Portsmouth, NH.
Detailed NPCs.
New adversaries.
… and more!

194972.name: Tarin's Crown (5E)
194972.description:
From publisher blurb:

An island adventure for 6th level characters in search of plunder and fame!

The treacherous jungle island known as Crown Isle was marked on every map for danger, as the verdant vegetation itself rose up to devour many who sought landing there until the infamous Captain Jared Tarin hacked out a refuge upon the mountain's hilly crest and made it his own. Other pirates sought to take him down, but each fell to the deadly dangers of the "Red Skewer" and his pirates, or to the still-wild jungle barely held at bay. When Tarin and his crew stole the Pirate Queen's Pearl, a flotilla of rivals blockaded his island for months, but none have dared to seize their chance. Can your eager band of buccaneers claim fame and fortune on the deadly isle of Tarin's Crown?

Islands of Plunder: Tarin's Crown is a 26-page 5th Edition adventure for 6th-level PCs fraught with harrowing battles on land and aboard ship, through treacherous terrain against even more treacherous foes. It includes two sets of maps, one for the GM an unkeyed set for players, , and can be easily dropped into any seafaring 5E campaign, whether in a published pirate setting or a campaign of your own design.

The Islands of Plunder series continues Legendary Games’ tradition of bringing you outstanding content for the 5th Edition of the worlds most famous roleplaying game by some of the best authors in the business, combined with amazing art and production values and innovative layout design.

194973.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 3.03 - Mar 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Misfit Studios' New Release - Game Products
What's Going On With Misfit Studios
194973.description:
From publisher blurb:

The monthly newsletters by Misfit Studios presents news regarding what is going on with the company, recaps the products it released during the previous month, and offers a product promotion.

194974.name: DAWAK
194974.description:
Aren't we all a bit DAWAK? Are you ready for more than 1000 crezy questions and tasks? Then this crazy party fun is just for you. Who wants to become Dawak champion needs to be fast and clever: Only the one who gives the correct answer first scores.

Contents: A "punch" card that goes to the center of the table. 9 plastic pieces (3 forms/colors, 3 sizes) around them. And a stack of 107 quiz cards (double side, 4 questions and one Dawak section on each side).

Players take turns as the host, who first rolls the die. On a roll of 1-4, he reads the corresponding question. A player who thinks he knows the answer has to hit the "punch" card in the middle of the table, and then he has three seconds to answer. The first player who gives the correct answer gets the card (max one answer per player)

The last 2 sides of the die show the word "Dawak". The dawak section on the card tells what to do now. Often, the players have to grab a specific one or several of the plastic pieces in the center. In other cases, the host has to mime something, sum a melody, sing a song, or the like. The players have to regonize it to claim the card.

Game ends when one player has collected 7 cards. He wins.

194975.name: The Road To Berlin! Feb-Apr 1945
194975.description:
From the cover:

Mission: Capture Berlin before the Americans/British!
Method: Massive ground assault from Oder Bridgehead
Ground Conditions: Mud
Enemy Strength: Fanatical Nazis, SS troops and Volksturm. Resistance cannot last beyond a few days. Morale seems to be good despite other reports.
Fuel situation critical. Ammunition limited. We will bury the Nazis.

194976.description:
Ni-Ju ("20" in japanese) is a tile laying game for 2 players.

In Ni-Ju, players compete to create the pattern depicted on at least one of their tiles by surrounding that same tile with other tiles. Each player has 20 tiles and each tile has a different pattern, hence the name of the game (20). There are 70 different patterns if we include rotations.
boardgameversion: English first edition with acrylic tiles
English First Edition with carboard tiles
194976.name: Ni-Ju

194977.name: Adventures in the Borderland Provinces (Pathfinder)
194977.description:
From publisher blurb:

More adventure worth winning!

This book contains seven stand-alone adventures for use in any campaign, or in the Lost Lands campaign setting. From the ghostly terrors of Ectarlin’s Last Ride to the fey-filled journey of Illusion and Illumination, these adventures provide you with a wide variety of challenges to puzzle and threaten the characters.

Nothing is as it seems, and dangers lie around every corner!

194978.name: Adventures in the Borderland Provinces (Swords & Wizardry)
194978.description:
From publisher blurb:

More adventure worth winning!

This book contains seven stand-alone adventures for use in any campaign, or in the Lost Lands campaign setting. From the ghostly terrors of Ectarlin’s Last Ride to the fey-filled journey of Illusion and Illumination, these adventures provide you with a wide variety of challenges to puzzle and threaten the characters.

Nothing is as it seems, and dangers lie around every corner!

194979.name: Adventures in the Borderland Provinces (5E)
194979.description:
From publisher blurb:

More adventure worth winning!

This book contains seven stand-alone adventures for use in any campaign, or in the Lost Lands campaign setting. From the ghostly terrors of Ectarlin’s Last Ride to the fey-filled journey of Illusion and Illumination, these adventures provide you with a wide variety of challenges to puzzle and threaten the characters.

Nothing is as it seems, and dangers lie around every corner!

194980.name: Storm Serpent
194980.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each release for Crawthorne's Catalog of Creatures for the Pathfinder RPG presents a single, new creature for your Pathfinder RPG game, as presented by the famous and retired monster hunter and adventurer, Lord Crawthorne. Each release presents game stats for the new creature, as well as three adventure ideas to help insert them into your game.

The Storm Serpent is so named because it so enjoys sewing chaos with its ability to create massive, long-lasting storms that cause havoc for anyone caught in them. They are also deadly combatants capable of obscuring vision and unleashing a blast of concussive air from their fanged mouths.

194981.name: Egyptian Tomb Chambers
194981.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: Egyptian Tomb Chambers is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: Egyptian Tomb Chambers comprises 11 different large tiles that can be printed multiple times and arranged in limitless combinations. Rooms include burial chambers full of sarcophagi, treasure rooms, sacred pools and shrines, statues, mummification rooms and much more. The perfect set for creating exciting and unique tomb layouts to fill with sarcophagi, mummies and curses!

Also included:
A set of 300dpi full size png files, for poster printing or VTT.

194982.name: Science and Sea
194982.description:
From publisher blurb:

Manreia did not suffer any battles within its borders during the Bane War, but the nation still suffered grievous losses. She sent many soldiers and vast stories of supplies to aid the Army of Light in its battles. Since the war ended and Manreia surrendered, she has had to struggle under the Witches' tyranny, living in a turmoil that even Manreian ingenuity cannot overcome.

Refugees who left Manreian camps often boarded ships that carried them to the islands of the Discordian Sea. Most met with disaster, but a few have managed to survive on one of the many islands. Their lives are little easier than the ones they left behind, but at least they are less likely to directly encounter banes.

Science and Sea provides additional information about the nation of Manreia and life on the Discordian Sea within Accursed's setting of Morden. It includes a broad range of different adventure hooks for GMs and players looking to explore these specific regions. It also introduces new banes as well as Hindrances and Edges specific to these cultures.

194983.name: The Lion and the Unicorn
194983.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you remember the thrill of terror and tension when you first played Death Trap Equlaider and had to choose between a quick dance with death or a long, lingering dramatic tango Did you ever wonder what it what be like to make a truly Herculean effort and to ge tthe recognition that such a feat of heroicism deserves?

Or perhaps you just hate demons and want to rid Trollworld of their foul kind?

There is a different type of magic, curse magic, and you may yet master this and live out all your dreams,

You might even take your first steps on the ladder that will elvate you above mortal life and take you all the way up to join the elite ranks of Wizard-Gods and Witch-Goddesses that cause all this trouble for humble player characters.

Now wouldn't that be a nice turn of events!

194984.name: Utopia City
194984.description:
From the designer:

Create your city and be the best mayor in the history over the 4 years (4 rounds in each year)! Set goals, fulfill promises, create your strategy and grow your city while maintaining the best levels of education, health, sustainability (ecology), security, entertainment and economy.

Each player purchases (with cash) Construction Tiles (houses, apartments, hospitals, cinemas, schools, industries etc) which will enhance the different levels of your city (security, health, education etc).

With high levels the player can complete Goal Cards that he acquired during rounds and also complete the requests of the television media (media cards), earning more points mayor and approval of the population. Implement projects (through project cards) can also help gain mayor points, gain approval of the population and increase the city levels.

To buy Construction Tiles, Goal Cards and Projects Cards, each player uses his meeples (city hall employees). Throughout the game, new meeples may be hired.

At the end of each year, players must have high approval of the population to gain even more Mayor Points. At the end of 4 years, which has more points Mayor is the winner!

From the designer (Portuguese):

Construa a sua cidade e seja o melhor prefeito da história ao longo de 4 anos (4 rodadas em cada ano)! Estabeleça metas, cumpra promessas, crie sua estratégia e faça crescer a sua cidade, mantendo os melhores níveis de educação, saúde, sustentabilidade (ecologia), segurança, lazer e economia.

Cada jogador compra com dinheiro Tiles de Construção (casas, apartamentos, hospitais, cinemas, escolas, indústrias etc.) que irão aumentar os diferentes níveis de sua cidade (segurança, saúde, educação etc.).

Com os níveis elevados, o jogador poderá completar Cartas de Objetivo que ele adquiriu durante as rodadas e também concluir as solicitações da mídia de televisão (cartões de mídia), ganhando mais pontos de prefeito e aprovação da população. Implementar projetos (através de cartões de projetos) também pode ajudar a ganhar pontos de prefeito, obter a aprovação da população e aumentar os níveis da cidade.

Para comprar tiles de construção, cartões de objetivos e cartões de projetos, cada jogador usa seus meeples (funcionários da prefeitura). Durante o jogo, novos meeples podem ser contratados.

No final de cada ano, os jogadores devem ter alta de aprovação da população para ganhar ainda mais pontos de prefeito. No final de 4 anos, que tiver mais pontos de prefeito é o vencedor!

194985.name: Grown From Steel
194985.description:
From publisher blurb:

They may appear as ponies, but the heart within pulses not with blood, nor their souls the spirit of any equine. Enter the world of those not truly alive, yet thirsting for excitement that only mortality brings.

New equipment, feats, and a god all designed for Steelhearts!

194986.description:
Humanity has inherited the stars, but humanity being what it is, the stars forever slip from its grasp. Even the First Sovereignty, which scattered humanity to a million worlds, has collapsed, consigned to oblivion. No one remembers what brought it about, whether a withering apathy, rebellions across its repressed worlds, or the impenetrable whims of the enigmatic, inhuman Xeno. Yet humanity is tenacious. There are always more fledgling civilizations ready to rise to the heights of power and culture, invent new technologies, and usher in a new millennium.

Deep Future is a card-driven board game for 1-3 players of empire and innovation spanning the rise and fall of the countless worlds of the galaxy. You will settle on planets, expand your influence across sectors, invent new technologies and rediscover old ones, and face challenges that threaten to tear your civilization apart as you try to achieve one of several paths to victory.

Deep Future is a “Make-as-You-Play” game, which means that the game starts with a few materials (a map, paper, index cards, and colored cubes) and the remaining components will be generated as needed during play. Each game will see the addition of new cards, which represent the worlds in the galaxy, the techs invented, and the lasting impact of previous civilizations.

The rules include tables and guidelines for creating new cards as needed, and this makes every copy of Deep Future an evolving galaxy. In addition, it means that each game inherits all components added or changed in the previous games. The galaxy’s content — its worlds, techs, and history — can grow endlessly over a connected campaign as players return to see what each new era holds for the future of humanity.
194986.name: Deep Future

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
194987.name: Krosul's Kofaadsa
194987.description:
From publisher blurb:

Krosul's Kofaadsa is a crowd-sourced old-school fantasy adventure setting. Scattered about a free map from FreeFantasyMaps.org are award-winning entries from the One-Page Dungeon Contest and some free modules that got a thumbs-up from Ten Foot Pole. These are some of the best adventures available on the internet, free or otherwise. There are still plenty of blanks to fill in, but most of these adventures are just a couple days away from each other, so you don't have to fill a lot in if you don't want to. No historical background is provided, as it is expected that this will emerge through play.

194988.name: In The Company of Dragons (5E)
194988.description:
From publisher blurb:

You know you want to play a Dragon!

Not a half-dragon, not a dragonborn, but a DRAGON!

Come and find out if those who meddle in your affairs are crunchy and good with ketchup. Level up as a dragon and grow to the size of a house, breath fire, (or other energy types), struggle for territory, win prestige amongst dragons, slay giants, rule the sky, and embrace you true draconic essence right alongside all the other player characters.

Create the dragon you want to play in the 5th Edition of the World's Most Popular Fantasy Roleplaying Game. This product includes the new dragon race the Taninin, racial traits, subraces, thre racial class archetypes, the paragon racial class (that lets you advance as a dragon), and draconic feats. All so you can play dragons alongside any other player character in any high fantasy campaign setting.

194989.name: Fedor Gorefang
194989.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nemesis NPCs – Fedor Gorefang is a chaotic evil male orc with cavalier levels with no archetype. At low levels his mount is a horse, but he upgrades to a gorthek when available. His specialty is mounted melee combat utilizing a lance and battleaxe.

This product is Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game compatible and gives you twenty ready-to-play stat blocks for a fearsome foe at all levels, 1 thru 20! This allows you to easily introduce an enemy into your campaign and reintroduce the same enemy at any time with no prior preparation. Simply find the appropriate challenge rating and go. The NPC advances along with your players with no work on your part.

If you find the character’s history and other story elements not to your liking, you still have twenty NPC stat blocks you can use as standalone characters of your own naming and developing or as minions and other rabble. Increase your available NPC stat blocks at every character level (Challenge Rating 1/2 thru 19).

The Nemesis NPCs series is designed to make the GM’s life easier. Each release provides numerous stat blocks that can be used immediately along a specific theme. Locate a specific kind of foe to introduce into your campaign or collect them all to build a toolbox of NPCs to unleash at any time. Give your players a new nemesis today!

194990.name: Warhammer 40,000: Codex Eldar
194990.description:
The Craftworlds of the Eldar are scattered across the stars, massive drifting starships that are home to last survivors of a race that once ruled the universe.

This is a supplement for Warhammer 40,000.

194992.name: Goblins en la mina
194992.description:
Goblins en la mina is a filler card game for 2 to 6 players, with playing time of 30-45 minutes. The objective of the game is to be the first in amassing a determinate number of gold ingots (depending of the number of players). To achieve this aim, the players can explore the mine, fighting monsters and facing other dangers. Is also possible to get the gold attacking other player’s dungeons, if you find one of the old hidden passageways to do it...

Each player takes the role of a goblin dungeon master in order to create his own dungeon, choosing between the different types of goblins, and building different rooms to upgrade the dungeon.
Goblins en la mina is crazy humorously game for all the family, and the art is done to create this atmosphere. Lots of fun and laughts are assured with each play of this game.
Goblins is also a game that contributes (giving part of its benefits) to a solidarity association called Ayudar Jugando. This association works and collaborates in different causes related with children in difficult situations.

194993.description:
The Imperium Chronicles Combat Card Game is an easy-to-understand, fast-paced game between two players. Players alternate between being the Attacker and the Defender, each using a Unit Card and multiple Modifier Cards each round. The winner of each round earns a point and the first player to reach 10 points wins the game.

Note: You only need to buy ONE deck for BOTH players to play! A single deck includes everything you need for two players!
194993.name: Imperium Chronicles Combat Card Game

194994.name: Parallel
194994.description:
Parallel is a 2-4 four player light-weight matching card game of deduction and strategy. Play consists of being dealt (4) randomized playing cards; followed by the clockwise execution of various actions in a race to match the goal card in the center. This means that each players goal is unique to their perspective of the goal card. After the cards are dealt, each players stands them keeping them secret. Each round consists of checking for matches, and execution of actions until one player claims victory. Players begin with (4) action tokens and lose one for every match. Action tokens replenish at the beginning of each players turn, after their first turn.
Their are two types of actions. The Swap and Switch actions effect your cards, while the Flip and Spin action effect the goal card. This is important because players cannot win on the same turn as manipulating their own cards. This means, in order to win, a player must come into their turn having 4 matching, a winning board state, or have the ability to Flip or Spin the goal card into a winning position. Winning a round grants a VP token.

For more on Parallel please follow @ParallelCG on twitter or check out Parallel.Mozello.Com

194995.name: The Cliffs of Vad Khara
194995.description:
from the introduction

The Cliffs of Vad Khara is an introductory adventure designed for Undiscovered: The Quest for Adventure. It is suitable for 4 to 6 characters of 1st to 3rd level.

This adventure is the prequel to the full length adventure: Kings of the Desert, available from Eilfin Publishing (fall, 2002).

194996.description:
Mishmash Galaxy is a light strategy game of long-term planning, memorization and card management in which you combine made-believe substances to complete and construct the staples of SF technologies! Make clichés and tropes come to life as you struggle to create FTL drives, time machines, portals and laser weaponry!

The goal of the game is to be the player with the most victory points! Players can earn victory points mostly by completing technologies; whenever a technology is completed, all contributors get the minor score of that technology, and if there is a major contributor, that player earns the major score. On a turn, a player can execute two actions, none of which are obligatory. The actions are:

• Play a Research Card: A player can put one of their Substance Card face down in front of them. At the beginning of their next turn, this card is revealed and its research ability is activated. Then the card should be discarded. You can never have more than one active Research Card.

• Contribute to a Technology: Each player can contribute a card from their hand to two different Technologies. Any card can be contributed (Ingredient or Substance) as long as the resource of the card are correct with the resources needed in that Technology stage. Each Technology is being filled in order of their blueprint, from left to right. You play the cards face down and place your ownership token on the card. Resolving the Technology works as below:


All cards on the Technology are revealed.
Cards are then activated from right to left. Owner of the card is the one who resolves the card Technology ability.


The game ends when all Technologies prepared for the game are completed.
194996.name: Mishmash Galaxy

194997.name: Djumble
194997.description: In Djumble, players reveal cards from the deck that have descriptions such as "green", "floats", or "weighs more than 1 kg", then everyone races around the house — or wherever they're playing — to find something that fits as many of these categories as possible, then they argue about which things fit best in order to score points.

194998.name: Mad Love
194998.description:
Believing you have made the archaeological discovery of a lifetime, you and your group of intrepid explorers enter an unknown desert tomb, only to be immediately trapped in an endless Dreamscape full of maddening visions of terror. Escape the mysterious tomb by ridding yourself of all Madness or by becoming the last explorer standing. Explorers who collect too much Madness are trapped inside, doomed to forever roam the nightmarish Dreamscape.

Mad Love is a pocket game of memory, bluffing, and deduction played with a deck of 22 cards. Explorers attempt to rid themselves of Madness and inflict it on others by secretly placing cards from their hands face down into a mysterious 3 x 3 card grid called the Dreamscape. There can only be a total of 9 cards in the Dreamscape at any time, when a card is introduced onto one edge of the Dreamscape, it moves all cards in that row or column one space over. This pushes the card on the opposite edge out of the grid toward another explorer who must flip the card over, immediately perform the action noted on the card, then take the card into hand. The key is to remember the locations of certain cards placed into the Dreamscape, then maneuver them around the grid to get the desired results: less Madness for you...more Madness for your fellow adventurers.

Instagram: imphouse
Facebook Page: imphouse

194999.name: Combat Advantage: Volume One
194999.description:
From publisher blurb:

This collected volume contains all seven initial editions of Combat Advantage for 4e. Includes over 26 powers, 12 feats, five NPCs/monsters, and optional rules for having a greater power selection and using sidekicks in your party.

195000.name: Control Tower: LAX Airport
195000.description:
From the designer:

Control Tower: LAX Airport is a family boardgame about the management of the planes in an airport.
The players are air controllers who must land and take off the planes and distribute those planes in the diferent areas of the airport like repair/maintenance garage or refuelling to satisfice their requeriments.

The game is based on Control Tower with new mechanism.
The players share the LAX Airport while in Control Tower each player manage his own airport. This change makes different feelings between both games.

Control Tower: LAX Airport is an addictive boargame for 2 to 5 players, with easy rules but complex making decisions.

From the designer (Spanish):

"Torre de Control" es un juego de mesa familiar sobre la gestión de aviones en un aeropuerto.
Los jugadores encarnan a controladores aéreos de la gestión interna de un aeropuerto y entre sus funciones están ordenar los aterrizajes y despegues de los aviones y las distribución de los aviones en los diferentes servicios del aeropuerto tales como repostaje y reparación y mantenimiento.

El juego esta basado en "Torre de Control" pero con nuevas mecánicas. En esta versión los jugadores tienen un único aeropuerto común a diferencia de la anterior versión que cada jugador tenia el suyo propio. Este cambio hace que ambas versiones transmitan unas sensaciones de juego totalmente diferentes.

"Torre de control: Aeropuerto LAX" es un juego adictivo de 2 a 5 jugadores, de reglas muy sencillas pero con mucha toma de decisiones.

194501.description: Happy Pigs: Penguins is a set of forty penguin tiles — ten each in four sizes — that can be used in the Happy Pigs game in place of the pigs. The same rules for breeding and caring for pigs apply to penguins; you can mix different animals in your fields or have each player specialize in a particular animal.
194501.name: Happy Pigs: Penguins

194503.name: Dinosaur Wars
194503.description:
Fight the elements and each other in a race to become the greatest Bone Hunter in the Badlands!

Based on Dinosaur Fossil hunting in the late 1800's, Dinosaur Wars is a board game for 2 - 4 players with a playing time of around 2 hours.

Object: You are a seasoned bone-hunter on assignment to a renowned museum.

Your mission is to field expeditions into the Badlands to plunder the Dinosaur Digsites there. Landing on a Digsite enables you to pick up or “excavate” Bones Cards.

To maximize your haul of Bones Cards you will need equipment and the services of a sometimes disreputable crew. The more crew and equipment you have the greater your haul of bones cards. The race is then on to get your precious cargo back to your museum where complete sets of bones cards have a points and money value. Money enables you to fund your expeditions and points are recorded on the pad provided. The game continues until there are no more bones cards left to “excavate”. The winner is the player with the most points.

But beware! The attentions of Bone Rustlers and Claim Jumpers, the pitfalls of Calamity Cards and shady dealings at the Bones Bazaar may leave your collection in tatters, trust no-one and have no regard for the ethics of bone digging!

194504.name: The Princess' Heart
194504.description:
The Princess' Heart tells the story of a young princess who must travel the world to win her beloved's heart back.

Princess Aerin Goldheart suspects that her prince is sharing the bed with another woman. After once again becoming intoxicated and making a scene, the King and Queen send her away to a forest cottage. Aerin sneaks off to sign a contract with the Demon of Desire to make the prince love her again, but things go awry and she must travel the world to break the deal!

Enjoy up to 15 hours of classic Role-Playing gameplay! The Princess' Heart takes you back in time with a touching story of unrequited love, a medieval setting and timeless graphics.

With 8 exciting playable characters, you can play any way you like. The innovative battle system is simple yet strategic and spells have an area of effect, so you must choose your targets wisely. Travel through a vast world of traditional settings: deserts, sky cities, fire caves, mazes and more.

Help Aerin free her soul from the curse of Izdul-Kalag, before all is lost!

Source: The Developer Website.

194505.description:
Tallinn (Reval, Castrum Danorum) in late 14th century: You try to make the three most powerful forces in the city your allies, namely the Teutonic Knights, the church/monasteries, and the merchants.

Each player starts Tallinn with an identical set of ten cards. These cards have two halves, each with icons representing the influence in one or two of the groups. Every round each player selects one card secretly, touching the side of the card they want to be valid, then all players reveal/place their card simultaneously. The players add their played card to their display, overlapping the cards, so that only the half that they touched when revealing the card is seen. The other half is taken out of play for this game.

Some cards show icons that allow you to collect victory points immediately. When doing so, you compare your total of power of the specific group with each of the other players, scoring some points for each player you beat and less in case of a tie.

In game end scoring, you compare all symbols with all of your competitors and gain additional points when having more symbols of a kind, and fewer points in case of a tie. Finally, you score more points for each face-to-face victory when comparing the symbols on cards you have taken out during the game as part of the city wall.

Scoring during the game weakens your display because the scoring symbol is only on card halves with a single icon of influence, while other card halves show up to three icons.

Tallinn is the second game in the cycle of little tiny card games of Medieval Theme in the Baltic Sea by OSTIA-Spiele, following VISBY.
194505.name: Tallinn

194506.name: Dweep
194506.description:
"Dweep is a cute and cuddly purple creature who must negotiate a series of dangerous obstacles to rescue defenseless baby Dweeps."

Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dweep,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

194507.name: Witch: Fated Souls
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 63 - Xia: Legends of a Drift System, Witch: Fated Souls, The Beast
194507.description:
From the back of the book:

Delve into the world of the Fated. Discover hidden secrets and ancient artefacts. Explore the planes, manipulate aether, and shape the gauze. But be wary, the demons are ever watchful, hungry for souls and waiting to play their wicked games.

Witch: Fated Souls is a dark, modern fantasy role playing game. You play a member of the Fated, a person who has sold their soul to a demon for power. The mysteries of magic and the countless wonders of our world are now yours.

While you explore the cosmos you must be wary. Hunters and other antagonists lukr in the shadows ready to strike, but most of all, watch out for your demon. Can you beat your demon at their own game and regain your soul? Embrace your fate and find out.

194508.name: Element Circle
194508.description:
Element Circle is the tactical, magical card game. The game is availlable to play digitally online and you can buy a paper version to play with your friends.

In Element Circle the players battle each other over the control over the four elements Earth, Water, Fire and Air. In the circle appear four elements at random that can be used by any player and the players obtain spells from the same deck. The players then choose their innate elements that only they can use and take turns to use their spells to beat the other players. Each element has their own signature effect.


Earth is a solid and cannot affect the elements.
Water is a fluid and alters the state of the game.
Fire is destruction and intense.
Air is motion and mobility.


Element Circle is played in rounds. Depending on how the players act, a round can be very short or relatively long. The trick to winning Element Circle is to be able to see how to play your hand best, predict the actions of your opponents and to best judge the strength of your own hand as well as those of your opponents. There is a lot of randomness in the rounds that keeps it interesting to play. Even the best players will lose some rounds, but will eventually win more rounds than others. Normally the first player to win three rounds wins the game, but when playing online each win increases your score and rating.

194509.name: Chronicles of Darkness
194509.description:
From the back of the book:

Keep walking.

Eyes straight ahead.

Don’t look back.

In the shadows and between the cracks of our everyday lives hide the Chronicles of Darkness. Here lurk creatures of ancient myth and urban legend. Here lie the graves of angels and the bunkers of secret government programs. Here every malformed horror you’ve ever seen out of the corner of your eye has a home. And they’ve seen you.

Don’t look back!

Chronicles of Darkness RPG rulebook contains:

- A guide to creating characters to explore a world of modern horror, from hopes and fears to psychic powers.
- Dramatic rules for investigation, social manipulation, and bone-crunching violence.
- Over a dozen monsters straight out of weird fiction and urban legend… plus complete rules for creating your own.
- The God-Machine Chronicle, a massive collection of sample characters and techgnostic adventures.

194511.name: Venzia: Kit de Démo
194511.description:
This is the demo kit for Venzia, 52 pages with background, quickstart rules and an adventure, ready to play.

User Summary

Venzia is a French science-fantasy RPG. Planet Reggia is submerged under water since the Diluvio. In Venzia, the Doge employs the PCs to solve his problems behind the back of the council.

But there are other dark things happening: Black Chimeras, and Acqua Malefacente, a disease that cause mutations and disformities that still has no cure.

That's not without counting on the Hippogriffs, these ancient armors that provide super power to their users (the PCs).

It uses the open D6 system as translated by Les XII Singes

194512.name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms XIII
194512.description:
Romance of the Three Kingdoms 13 is the 13th installment in the Romance of the Three Kingdoms (Sangokushi) strategy game series by Koei. It was released in 2015 for the Xbox One and PC in Japan.[1] It was released in North America in January 2016.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romance_of_the_Three_Kingdoms_13 Romance of the Three Kingdoms 13]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

194513.name: Bloodlust Métal
194513.description:
User summary

This is the core rulebook for Bloodlust (Edition Métal)

Bloodlust Edition Métal is the new edition of the 1991 Bloodlust RPG. Same world, new system.

Tanæphis is a world at war. But the gods are weapons. Literally: they are living swords that instigate warmongering to their holders.

The rule system has a SRD licensed under a Creative Commons License.

194514.name: Bloodlust Métal SRD
194514.description:
User summary

This is the SRD for Bloodlust (Edition Métal) licensed under a Creative Commons License.

Bloodlust Edition Métal is the new edition of the 1991 Bloodlust RPG. Same world, new system.

Tanæphis is a world at war. But the gods are weapons. Literally: they are living swords that instigate warmongering to their holders.

194515.name: Dungeon War
194515.description:
Dungeon War is a game for 2-4 players, where the player control groups of Heroes and Monsters in an expanding dungeon and must gather as much treasure as they can, while using their monsters to defeat the other treasure Hunters.

The game uses tiles to expand the dungeon so no two game will ever be exactly the same. Using a quick and simple turn based system, even with 4 players the game is so fast paced, no one will get bored waiting for their turn. The 62 Event cards add constant challenges to the expanding dungeon and will make even the most seasoned treasure hunter squirm as the dungeon deals its next deadly torment their way.

When the event deck is exhausted or if only one hero remains in the dungeon the game comes to an end and its time to count up the treasure and whom ever has the most will win the game.

194516.name: Echo Tokyo: Intro
194516.description:
User Summary

Echo Tokyo: Intro is an introduction into the world of Echo Tokyo. it is a post apocalyptic cyberpunk visual novel.

194517.name: Super Fantasy Brawl
194517.description:
Super Fantasy Brawl is a fast-paced, tactical skirmish combat board game featuring heavy bluffing and double-guessing mechanics.

Players draft teams of 4 heroes with individual sets of skills and try to beat the crap out of each other.

To win the game, players need to control specific objectives on the map.

194520.name: Monopolis
194520.description:
Monopolis (eng. Monopoly) game was made in Lithuania when this country was part of the Soviet Union, like the other Baltic states.

Just before the end of Soviet Union, politics became softer and allowed more things from the western culture like this game for example (not actual Monopoly version). Such things became popular among people, but the rule that everything had to be written in Russian remained, that's why this game's Rules are written in Russian.

The yellow lid of the game box only show the "shareholder cards" as well as some of the little "Chance cards".
Each side of the little game board has 3 company spaces, 1 railwaystation and a "destiny" space (showing a yellow circle with some image).

The 23 spaces on the board are from onwards:
Pepsi-Cola -10%-circle - Marlboro - Knïb (Kiev) - Las Vegas - a Jail corner - Philips - policeman in circle - Opel - Alma-Ata - Ford - cowboy on totem pole (Destiny corner) - Parker - sun and cube in circle - Toyota - New York - Asahi - judge corner - Atlantic - sun and cube in circle - Honda - London and Panam.

The instruction on the destiny spaces respectively reads:

side 1: pay 10% of your funds and put it in the "destiny pool".
side 2 with the policeman: pay a fine of 500 and put it in the "pool".
side 3 and 4: test your luck by taking a Chance card. It is remarkable to see that the "Destiny corner" is officially used as the "Free Parking corner" in the unofficial family rules in Parker Brother editions!




Besides, there is an inner circle in the center of the game board, called Klondike, being an essential part of the game. Klondike can be entered any moment, by paying the Bank 500. Starting point is the pointing hand as in the main part of the game. The Rules for this section are as follows:

Landing on each of the empty yellow spaces player receives 1000 from the Bank.
Landing on the space with the gold coin player receives 5000 and the right to return to the main game.
Landing on the space with the money bag player receives 10000 and the right to return to the main game.
Landing on the space with the pistol player loses all his money received in Klondike and has no right to leave the Klondike.
Landing on the space with the black cat player loses all his money received in Klondike and must return one of his most precious shareholder cards to the Bank as well as one of the cheapest he owns, but he still has the right to return to the main game.
Landing on the space with the pointing hand player must return to the main game with the money he collected in Klondike.
Philips shareholder card. Instead of property deeds players receive a shareholder card from the banker the moment they buy shares of a property or station.




How does that work? Let us take the Philips property to explain:
The first share, together with the "shareholders card" (like a "property deed" in Parker Bros. Monopoly) can be bought for 16 the moment you land on this free space. A next player landing on this space have to pay you 4.

When you are short of cash you can pawn this card with the Bank for 8.

A second share can be bought from the Bank for 160 after which a visitor must pay you 40. The value of this share however is 140. In order to remember how many shares you own on this property you place the blue plastic paperclip on line 2.

In this way one can collect up to 5 shares by finally paying 6400. That moment the value of your total shares is 3200 and any visitor has to pay you 1600 each time he lands on this property. Should you run out of cash you can pawn this card with the Bank for 3200.
There are 18 small (56x69 mm) yellow Chance cards, to be placed on the red dot in the centre of the board.

Some of the instructions on these Chance cards read:

Konkurentu dovana gangsteriui 1000$ = Player receives 1000 from each other player and he gets the right to throw the dice 3 times.




In addition he is allowed to rob another player, f.e. the moment he lands on a space owned by another player the owner must hand over all profit to this player.

Nenumatytos pajamos 50% = Player receives 50% of his own properties (stocks and stations) from the Bank.
Mafija 1000 $ = Player has to proceed to the Destiny corner and pay 1000 fine.
Air Mail = Player does not move per space but per board side. On doing so he is allowed to land on a space he likes, except on the corner spaces. However, he does receive 200 passing the Start corner.




Black cat = Player must return one of his shareholder cards to the Bank, without the right to redeem it.

The procedure with the stations is somewhat different: When buying a station player has to pay 800 to the Bank and in the same time he receives a hexagonal, plastic chip. The more stations a player owns the bigger profit he gets. The moment another player lands on your station he owes you 200 per station. Should an owner runs out of cash he can, like with the other properties, pawn a station with the Bank for 400 with the opportunity to redeem the station when he has enough money again.

The money consists of rather a number of plastic coins in various colors and diameters. The 11 denominations are: 1 - 2 - 5 - 10 - 20 - 50 - 100 - 500 - 1000 - 5000 and 15000.

194521.name: The Slaughter: Act One
194521.description:
User Summary

Set in Victorian England, solve the clues to find a serial killer.

194522.name: Plantera
194522.description:
User Summary

Grow a garden full of plants and harvest the fruit. As you play animals will join to help you harvest.

194523.description:
Eric M. Lang and Bruno Faidutti have joined forces to create the ultimate prisoner's dilemma game. Do you cooperate and risk getting outsmarted by a greedy player? Or do you compete and risk losing everything?

You are pirates who just looted a ship and must negotiate how to split the treasure. There are seven types of loot with values from 1 to 3. At the end of the game, you only score the treasure types you have the most and least of.

On each turn, open four new treasures: two in front of you and two in front of your neighbour. Simultaneously decide how to split them. Choices:


Peace (I want the 2 in front of me)
War (I want them all)
First pick (I want just one, pick first)


If both players choose peace, split the loot evenly. If both choose war, lose all treasure. If both choose first pick, lose all treasure and one of your gained treasure columns.

The game continues until the Dawn Card is drawn. 15 minutes!
194523.name: HMS Dolores
boardgamepodcastepisode: 19. Devon Dice Dreaming to Essen trip 2016, Top 10 wants to Buys
DJ126: Dolores (2016) Bruno Faidutti + Eric M. Lang

194524.name: Verids
194524.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this special player focused volume of the Deadly Gardens series we present the Verids, a player character race of intelligent plant creatures. The Verids are an extraterrestrial species that have been inserted into the planet’s biome.

In this volume:

Verids, a player character race of extraterrestrial plant beings.
Alternate Racial Traits
Favored Class Bonuses
A Racial Archetype: the Terraformer (Kineticist)
Racial Equipment, Feats and Spells.
Plant companions to use with Verid Characters.
The Verid Surveyor, a typical Verid NPC.

194525.name: Natural Items 5E
194525.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Deadly Gardens Extra document provides the rules for Natural Items as a separate, free download so that we can avoid reprinting the same rules in future volumes of the series.

In this volume:

Natural Item Rules
2 New Natural Items: Cockatrice Tongue and Mimic Adhesive

194526.name: Natural Items
194526.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Deadly Gardens Extra document provides the rules for Natural Items as a separate, free download so that we can avoid reprinting the same rules in future volumes of the series.

In this volume:

Natural Item Rules
2 New Natural Items: Mimic Adhesive and Mimic Adhesive

194527.name: Ophidian Vine
194527.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or OGL campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

In this volume:

3 New Feats: Deadly Gardener, Toxin Wrangler and Venom Doctor
Rules for Natural Poisons
Complete list of Natural Poisons from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Bestiary creatures: Ant to Wyvern
Ophidian Vine CR &frac;12;
Greater Ophidian Vine CR 4
2 New Natural Items: Ophidian Vine Sap, Greater Ophidian Vine Sap

194528.name: Swarm of Blood Roses 5E
194528.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your 5th Edition Fantasy campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

In this volume:

Swarm of Blood Roses CR 2
2 Magic Items: Cloak of Fallen Leaves and Quickgrow Beans
4 Alchemical Items: Calming Pollen, Clearwater Drops, Tough-husk Oil, Vita-Grow




2 Natural Hazards: Rockslide and Sinkhole
5 Terrain Types: Kudzu, Scree, Steep Scree, Thicket and Dense Thicket

194529.name: The Raid (Pathfinder)
rpgseries: The Northlands Series: The Long Night of Winter
194529.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Raid is an adventure for the Northlands Saga setting and is the second adventure in The Long Night of Winter adventure anthology. Like the other adventures in the anthology, The Raid is intended to be dropped into a Northlands Saga campaign by the GM/Referee at any time or place that is convenient. It is not, therefore, tied to any particular location in the Northlands or to any specific time beyond occurring near the beginning of spring as the viking raiding season is about to begin.

Pathfinder Roleplaying Game character level: 6-8

194530.name: The Raid (Swords & Wizardry)
rpgseries: The Northlands Series: The Long Night of Winter
194530.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Raid is an adventure for the Northlands Saga setting and is the second adventure in The Long Night of Winter adventure anthology. Like the other adventures in the anthology, The Raid is intended to be dropped into a Northlands Saga campaign by the GM/Referee at any time or place that is convenient.
